campaign.story:
On day 3, Maximum Apocalypse funded with 3 apocalyptic themes and 6 survivor classes everything added up to 350+ cards with 120+ unique illustrations. We have unlocked ALL 22 STRETCH GOALS that have added more content and better components. 
Stretch Goal Content in Detail
  Robot Apocalypse, 30 extra cards including 3 new missions.
Community Apocalypse, 30 extra cards including new bosses and missions. 
New Survivor: The Scientist, a new versatile character class of 20 cards. 
New Survivor: Army Ranger, a sniper and crowd control character class of 30 cards.
Upgraded Components: card dividers, cardboard tiles, custom wooden tokens, component and card upgrades, etc. 
3 Kickstarter Exclusive Promo Cards: Fireman boss card, alternate hunter and gunslinger card. 
8 New Game Tile Locations: Amusement Park, Desert, Mountains, Factory, Oasis, Prison, Airport and the Military Base
Maximum Apocalypse is now stretched to perfection and Kickstarter backers are getting the first 82 card expansion for Free as part of this campaign. The game is as good as it can possibly be right now!
Please take a look at the Whats in the Box? and Stretch Goals sections below for more details on all the amazing content in store for Kickstarter backers.
Thank you all for an unbelievably fun, positive and successful campaign!
Maximum Apocalypse is a cooperative roguelike adventure game for 1-6 players. Civilization has already fallen. The players must survive the hostile landscape.   
The game map is randomly generated and different every time that you play. On each turn, a player can use up to four actions to explore the map, play cards, equip weapons, scavenge for resources, draw cards or battle off monsters.  
Picking a unique survivor class within the group, players must plan their strategy and work together while leaning on their survivor’s strengths in order to defeat monsters and avoid starvation. For example, the Fireman is deadly up close with his ax and can easily chop down monsters; meanwhile the stealthy Hunter is great at scouting the map and avoiding traps — but roaming monsters are gathering quickly and time is running out. If players are overwhelmed by monsters or die of starvation, they lose. If they can find enough fuel and get it back to their van to escape, they all win and live to play another scenario.
As a survivor of the apocalypse, players will equip weapons, battle monsters, draw cards and scavenge the post-apocalyptic wasteland looking for useful supplies. 
Cooperation is key in this deep game of survival.  
It's Different Every Time you Play
Maximum Apocalypse comes with (at least) 3 totally different post-apocalyptic scenarios. When you mix these scenarios with different monsters, map tiles, scavenge items, missions and characters classes, you get a near infinite amount of combinations and maps with tons of replayability.
Zombie - Don't get overwhelmed by the Undead...luckily they're not too bright.
Nuclear - Be prepared to give away your gear to nasty raiders before facing poisonous mutant rats.
Alien - Race against the clock as the aliens force you to discard your deck as they work to ensure the enslavement of humanity.
Robot - Fight the never ending replication and efficiency of your robotic overlords.
Choose your Survivor
The Fireman is sturdy, strong and acts as the tank of the group. With his axe in hand, he is a massive short range damage dealer.
The Hunter is stealthy and precise. She can scout the landscape for danger and is deadly with her bow and traps.
The Gunslinger can deal midrange damage with his trusty revolvers as long as he has ammunition. 
The Surgeon supports the group by restoring health and boosting team performance with shots of adrenaline.
The Veteran and his Dog are a team unto themselves.  The Vet has plenty of old military gear and his dog has excellent instincts. He's trained to scout and attack if necessary.
The Mechanic is a support class that can upgrade weapons, build defensive turrets or even call in a drone strike to clear a path forward.
The Scientist (KS BONUS!) is a quick learner that can adapt to the situation and research new skills and weapons.
The Army Ranger (KS BONUS!) is a sniper that can remove monster tokens and help control the onslaught of monsters.
Explore and Survive!
Every turn, Players take 4 actions to explore the randomized map, fight off monsters, play cards and scavenge for resources.
When you move to a new tile, you reveal it and get free actions or potentially fall into a trap...
There are two types of cards you can play on your turn: Instants and Gear.
Instants are one shot cards that you play for their effect and then are discarded. Gear is equipped and takes up inventory slots but stays in play giving you access to new abilities. You will need to equip weapons and other gear to help you survive and fight dangerous roaming monsters.
As you explore the map, you’ll come across new locations. Some of them are good and some can be very bad.
Once your turn is over, your hunger increases and monsters attack so you'll want to work together as a team to optimize your actions.
Complete your Objective and Escape
As part of setup, players will select a mission or scenario. Most missions require finding a particular location and collecting enough fuel to escape.
Face Roaming Monsters
For example, an early mission is to rescue a Scientist who may be able to cure the Zombie outbreak. In that scenario, the Scientist has barricaded himself in the Police Station. Players will search for the police station, rescue the scientist and then bring him back to the van to escape.
Once you've completed the mission objective and collected the required fuel, you'll have to hightail it back to your van to escape.  There may even be a mighty boss to face on your race back.
Get into the nitty gritty of the rules here and check out some of the missions here. 
Download our Free Prototype PNP here.
If you have tabletop simulator, check out our digital prototype here.
  6 Unique Survivor Decks of 30 Cards - Fireman, Gunslinger, Surgeon, Hunter, Veteran & his Dog, and the Mechanic (180 Cards)
4 Apocalyptic Scenarios with 25 Card monster decks - Zombie, Nuclear Wasteland, Rise of the Robots and Alien Invasion (100 Cards)

Maximum Apocalypse is modular and expandable, so you can look forward to more apocalyptic scenarios and new survivor classes in the future to mix up your play experience. But if you back now and spread the word... we just might be able to squeeze more into the box! All the unlocked Stretch Goals (except for the play mat add-on) are included for free to all $40+ backers .

You will be able to specify all the rewards that you want to receive in our post-project surveys and/or pledge manager.
We will be charging flat shipping for this campaign. We know that shipping (especially internationally) can be annoyingly expensive; believe us, we are just as annoyed as you are! We are continuing to work toward minimizing the cost of shipping as much as possible. We don't want to stick anyone with a large shipping bill long after the campaign is over, so we will be subsidizing shipping equally in all regions so that we can charge affordable flat rate shipping:
United States + UK: $5 
Canada + Australia: $10
European Union: $10 - $15 (Depending on Country & Reward)
Switzerland, Norway: $15
Everywhere Else: $20  
We plan on using customs-friendly shipping and fulfillment companies in each region to keep shipping costs as low as possible so that you can back more games! As a result, you should not get hit with customs, brokerage, or import fees. 
Shipping is annoyingly expensive. However, to help offset the shipping costs a bit, there are workarounds. The shipping rates will remain fixed regardless of the number of games or add-ons that you purchase. If you have a bunch of friends who want to support this project, just make one group pledge for as many games as you’d like.
Retailers  
We like to support game stores around the world by offering the special Kickstarter versions of the game to retailers during the campaign. We treat retailer backers just like other backers in that they receive their rewards before we release regular retail games into distribution. If you're a retailer, please contact Mike directly at mike@rockmanorgames.com during the campaign for pricing information or back at the Retailer Pledge Level and we will be in touch.
Rock Manor Games successfully funded Brass Empire at the end of 2015 through Kickstarter. It was released 8 months later and subsequently sold out in limited distribution. We had so much fun making that game that we've been working on a bunch of new projects over the past few years and hope to have a very busy 2017-2018. The reception we've received has been amazing and we are thrilled to continue our work in the game industry.
    About the Team
Mike with his wife Rose and daughter Penelope - Photo by Little Nest
Mike Gnade is a 10 year game industry veteran based in Wilmington, Delaware where he lives with his family.  He is obsessed with games of all kinds and is the designer and producer behind Maximum Apocalypse. He has been deeply involved in the indie gaming scene creating his own games and founding sites like IndieGameMag.com and IndieGameStand.com before designing his own tabletop games. 
  Gustav Rangmar is a freelance illustrator and concept artist from Sweden.  He is the one responsible for all of your gorgeous artwork.  You can see more of his work here.
Matt Cangialosi, our lead playtester and marketing guru, is a gaming fanatic based up in Boston, MA.  His early feedback was essential and assisted with additional game design and playtesting.
Martin Lauzon is a freelance Canadian video producer/animator and did an amazing job putting together our Kickstarter video.  You can contact him at albrech1s@gmail.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are fortunate to have gone through the Kickstarter process before and delivered our games to our backers in about 8 months from our project's end date. We attribute a lot of this speed to getting all of the core artwork completed upfront and have done the same with this project. We pride ourselves on communicating with our backers and impressing them by meeting deadlines and delivering an excellent product. 

As with turning any idea into a physical product, any number of problems can get in the way. While we can’t control everything, we can control our communication to our backers. Delays may happen, dates may change, but we will always be transparent and keep our backers in the loop.


PRODUCTION & SHIPPING

We plan on using the same manufacturers and fulfillment pipeline that we have used in the past to minimize complications and ensure a high quality product.

RULES 

Draft rules are available now under the Gameplay section. Please provide any feedback on them so that we can finalize the text and the rulebook shortly after the campaign.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

You are responsible for confirming your pledge, address and other information required to ship your product to you in a timely manner. If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Meeple Source has been making detailed, full-color Character Meeples for about six years now, and other painted components longer than that. We are proud to say that we have a reputation for high quality pieces and great customer service.

Even with the success of our 8 completed Kickstarter projects to date, we are still a very small, family-run company that takes great pride in taking care of our customers and their orders personally. As a result, in combination with the enormous number of custom product combinations that we allow in our Kickstarter projects, shipping takes a good deal of time. We do use a post-project management system (typically BackerKit) which helps keep everything orderly.

If you are one of our many repeat Kickstarter backers, you may know that a couple of our projects experienced minor delays, and that we were always straight-forward with regard to that. A distinct possibility for delay lies in the painting of the pieces, particularly Character Meeples. Although every individual meeple is hand-sorted for quality control, by us personally, there are times that errors in screen printing require that we re-make the entire batch of pieces for that particular Character Meeple. If this occurs, it will take a minimum of 8-10 weeks to replace them, which could delay shipping. For example, if this were to occur only a month before shipping would otherwise commence, some pledges would deliver after the estimated delivery date. Although we believe that we have allotted plenty of time for situations such as this, it should be noted that project delays are still a possibility. 

You may know that our last project delivered quite early, and although this could occur again, you should know that we believe our estimated delivery dates to be accurate.

More than anything, we are committed to quality. Our past customers know that this is true, and our Kickstarter backers know that we offer a money-back guarantee on all pledges. So don't worry, we've got this!

updates.update_userinfo: New Upgrades for Dinosaur Island and Wingspan!
updates.update_content: Hello! We wanted to send out a super quick update to let you know that just moments ago, we launched a Kickstarter project for amazing painted Dino Meeples for Dinosaur Island. They all match the art on the Dino Recipe Tiles (with permission from Pandasaurus Games), and we also have baby dinos and the 100mm MEGAREX!

This update will be short as we have a lot to do and want to get your orders out as quickly as possible. We now have all the pieces required to ship all remaining pledges! We just received them. They look good, and we are already working to sort, bag, and ship them. Please be patient as this can take some time, and shipping transit this time of year can be slower than usual. However, all remaining pledges will be shipping very shortly, if they haven't already! 
Thank you so much for supporting this fun project. We hope you all love your new pieces!

Shipping Update
We are nearing the end of October, when many pledges were scheduled to ship. The good news is that almost everything has shipped on time, with many sets shipping very early! Today you'll see photos of some of the new sets we just received, and we actually have already begun shipping those out to backers!

If you have seen all of your sets pictured here or in the previous updates, then your order has shipped or will ship very shortly. If not, your order will ship once it is complete and we have all of the sets you asked for.

Hello! We are very pleased to report that we have shipped over 600 orders, and that every order that is complete and can ship, has been shipped!
Below are some photos of the sets that are finished. If your order contains only items from these sets, your order is on the way to you now (if you haven't received it already, that is!)

I know this may seem very early, as the first sets weren't expected until October. And many of the sets will not be ready until those estimated times (October - December).  However, we will soon start to receive the first of the pieces from some of the many upgrade sets, and as always, we will begin shipping any complete orders as soon as possible. campaign.story:
Take control of one of the Five Families in a quest to become Boss of all Bosses. Play a full game in less than an hour or wage an EPIC MOB WAR for a whole evening of fun!
Each Family has their own special ability, suiting different strategies and personalities. Intimidate and fight your way to the top using brute force, or go for a more subtle approach of business and diplomacy. 
Rulebook | Libro de Reglas | Regelheft | Règles du jeu
Players take turns to complete 3 phases;
1. MONEY > 2. POWER > 3. RESPECT
1. Collect money and decide wether to take an assignment or snitch to the FBI for cash;
2. To the streets. Move 5 spaces and score points claiming territory, attacking and ordering hits;
3. Back in the office. Restock weapons and open businesses. Deposit cash, finish the day.  
A typical working day of a mafia boss. Score RESPECT points via attacks, area control and earning cash. The player with most points in a set number of rounds, wins.
✔ Fast paced - There are no dice.
✔ Action - Points via attacks, not victory.
✔ Negotiation - Bribe, trade and betray!
✔ Strategy - Characters special abilities.
✔ Bluffing - Rock-Paper-Scissors system.
✔ Betrayal - Snitch to jail opponents :-)
✔ Diplomancy - Form or break alliances.

updates.update_userinfo: GAMBONI is finally produced, deliveries start NOW!
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
I could not believe it myself until today, when I had GAMBONI in my hands for the first time in 4 years ... I could write a book about what happened in this period but at this moment I think it does not matter what I say, the only thing that matters is what I do and that is to deliver these boxes to you (in the EU) wherever I can I will do it in person. Outside EU is handled by Golden Bell.

We wanted to let everyone know that we are still here and we bring excellent news! The Gamboni game is in production! We are attaching a video (with some loud puppy barks) of the unboxing of the pre-production copy. We have gone through extensive editorial and feel we have made the game the best it can be. We are so thankful for those of you that have been so kind and patient during these trying times and we wish you and all your friends and family safe passage through this pandemic. The lead time on the production is about 30-45 days so we expect to start delivering Gamboni by the end of november to December just in time for the holidays. We can't wait to see what you all thinkand hope you're as excited as we are. Once again, we are quite sorry for the delay and hope that you can forgive us and see how hard we have all worked to make this a reality!

Calling all Gamboni backers!
We have exciting news. We’ve finally finished the update rulebook with all kinds of awesome variants. We’ve gotten in dozens of play tests and will have our final round at GenCon in a couple of weeks. Once GENCON wraps we’ll be sending the files to the factory within two weeks after that and expect to have the game finished with sampling within 30 days from that which puts us at mid September. The factory has a 90 day lead time (but we hope to get this cut down) so that puts us around beginning of Q1 or end of Q4 (but we all know holiday shipping in the U.S. is crazy and lots of packages often get lost due to the sheer volume so we're always hesitant shipping out during Christmas unless it comes before in November). Shipping to US takes about 30-40 days, barring we won’t get hit by port closings for Chinese New Year. It looks like delivery will be latest end of Q1 beginning of Q2. We can open up the BackerKit for shipping charges either now or closer to delivery, what would everyone prefer?. We are also attaching the final rulebook for everyone to review. If you have any feedback on it please let us know!

updates.update_userinfo: Gamboni Final Rulebook Enclosed - Nearing Production!
updates.update_content:
Hi all!
Marc from Golden Bell Studios here. I wanted to apologize for the slight delay in getting an update out to you since PAX Unplugged. We are normally in regular communication with Ewout however after PAX, I had to take a short business trip to New York that was unavoidable and I had not brought my computer with me. I am excited to share with you all the current status of Gamboni and expected timelines so that everyone is on the same page. I will also detail all the improvements that have been made to Gamboni since the unboxing video Rob and I had done which I’m sure most, if not all, of you have already watched!

Dear Backers,
First of all, again my sincere apologies for the delay in delivering the game as well as in posting updates. The good news is that production finally started and we should be able to still deliver this year. I hope it will be early November but it could also be December ...
I am grateful for your patience and understanding as this has taken a lot longer than planned and than I anticipated. After the initial delay due to legal and other issues, we finally got the proto in May this year (after almost a year after the campaign ended) so it looked like we could get the final product in your hands in August / September, round about now.

Dear Backers,
I am sorry to inform you that we're having another delay. Within 10 days we will know he definitive delivery date and post photos of what the finished product will look like.
Thank you for being so patient and considerate. I fully understand that patience is running out and so it should! We're working hard to get the right and accurate info ASAP.

campaign.story:
Hoi, ik ben Bastiaan!
Zes jaar geleden ben ik vanuit mijn zolder begonnen met het maken van filmpjes waarin ik probeer jullie een beeld te geven de verschillende bord- & kaartspellen die er zoal zijn. Daarnaast doe ik ook aan de verslaglegging van diverse Nederlandse & Belgische spellenbeurzen.
Jullie kunnen deze filmpjes vinden op Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/Dharquen
Ik maak deze filmpjes om mijn passie en enthousiasme voor bordspellen met jullie te delen en om jullie een beeld te geven van wat een spel te bieden heeft. Deze hobby geeft mij nog dagelijks heel veel plezier.
Maar nu komt het, mijn trouwe camera is stuk gegaan. Ik had deze camera 2e hands gekocht, het maken van de filmpjes blijft een hobby, en ik had nooit verwacht dat de reparatiekosten zo hoog zouden zijn. En ik wil heel graag verder gaan om, samen met jullie, nieuwe filmpjes te maken. Dus hoop ik op jullie steun om door te kunnen gaan met wat ik met zoveel liefde doe.
Jullie steun is onmisbaar!
Dankzij jullie, de fans, is Nox' Spellenzolder inmiddels een gevestigde naam geworden in bordspel spelend Benelux en daar ben ik trots op. En dat is voor een deel aan jullie te danken!
Om door te kunnen gaan zou ik jullie, mijn fans, om een bijdrage willen vragen voor een nieuwe camera. En als jullie per persoon slechts 1 euro zouden schenken, ben ik al uit de brand. Dus help Nox' Spellenzolder, doneer wat je kan missen en weet dat ik dankbaar ben voor elke gift.
Wat gebeurd er met het geld?
Het geld is bedoeld voor een nieuwe camera, de Canon 70D.
Het doel - de Canon 70D
Alles wat deze kickstarter oplevert gaat naar de camera & materiaal om de Spellenzolder nog beter in beeld te brengen. Middels updates zal ik jullie op de hoogte houden over de bestemming van het geld.
Daarnaast zijn de kosten voor het gebruik van Kickstarter.com ongeveer 10% van het totale bedrag.
Stretch Goals:
Als de kickstarter meer verzameld dan het bedrag dat ik nodig heb voor mijn nieuwe camera, zijn dit de nieuwe doelen waar het geld naartoe gaat. Hierbij wil ik een kleine slag om de arm houden, als het gaat om de volgorde, afhankelijk van de resultaten van de kickstarter.

1200 euro - De Canon Power Zoom Adapter, om soepeler in & uit te zoomen. Vooral handig op beurzen. FUNDED!

updates.update_content:
Hoi allemaal,
Even een kleine update, de funds van Kickstarter zijn binnen. Ik ben nu druk op zoek naar de meest aantrekkelijke prijzen voor de diverse onderdelen. Zodra de camera & accessoires binnen zijn, zal ik jullie middels een filmpje tonen wat voor upgrades de Spellenzolder heeft gekregen.
Geniet van de zon & misschien tot op Zomerspel.

updates.update_userinfo: De Kickstarter was een enorm succes!
updates.update_content:
Hoi allemaal,
De Kickstarter is afgelopen en het succes is al mijn verwachtingen overstegen. Iedereen heel erg bedankt. Het duurt nog ongeveer 2 weken voordat Kickstarter alles afgehandeld heeft en het geld naar mij stuurt. Zodra dat is gebeurd laat jullie weten wat het totaal is en waar het aan besteed zal worden..
Daarnaast wil ik iedereen een kleine blijk van waardering geven in de vorm van een Microbadge op Boardgamegeek. Als je mij een berichtje stuurt via Boardgamegeek (hier kun je mij vinden: https://boardgamegeek.com/user/Dharquen) en dan kun je onder mijn naam (naast de Nederlandse vlag) op de enveloppe klikken en een berichtje versturen. Dan stuur ik je een microbadge.

updates.update_userinfo: Nog 48 uur te gaan & wat een succes!
updates.update_content:
De Kickstarter gaat zijn laatste 48 uur in en ik ben een gelukkig mens. Ik heb het al vaker gezegd, maar jullie steun is werkelijk geweldig en ik kan daar niet genoeg voor bedanken!
Tot nu toe is er ruim 1250 euro via de Kickstarter opgehaald en ook nog het nodige daarbuiten. Zodra alles afgerond is zal ik jullie een overzicht geven van wat er dankzij jullie aan de Spellenzolder zal worden toegevoegd.
Nogmaals bedankt & ik hoop jullie weer flink van filmpjes te kunnen gaan voorzien!

Gegroet allemaal,

We hebben het 2e stretch goal gehaald! Wat een geweldig nieuws, nogmaals bedankt voor jullie steun. Jullie geven mij zoveel positieve energie en motivatie om filmpjes te maken, dat is lastig in woorden te omvatten. Maar weet dat ik er heel dankbaar voor ben en dat in ieder geval wil belonen met talloze nieuwe filmpjes.

Het begint bijna op Spam te lijken, maar ik wil het jullie toch niet onthouden.
Het 1e Stretch Goal is gehaald!
In plaats van de Canon 70D, kan ik nu de Canon 80D kopen.
Dit camera model is 3 jaar nieuwer, heeft meer megapixels (24 ipv 20) en kan opnemen met 60 frames/sec ipv 30. Jullie zijn geweldig!

Hoi allemaal,
We zijn officieel nog geen dag verder en de Kickstarter is reeds behaald. Ik ben super blij. Woorden schieten mij tekort om mijn dank voor alle steun te beschrijven . Ik heb zoveel fantastische reacties en donaties mogen ontvangen, dat er een nieuwe camera komt op de Spellenzolder. Dank jullie wel!

En gelijk een 2e update.
Een goede vriend en bordspelontwerper, Lee D'Arcy, is bezig met een aantal digitale spellen voor op de tablet. En hij heeft mij 50 download codes geschonken, waarmee je zijn nieuwste spel "Top Bun" kan spelen op je iPad (dus alleen nog beschikbaar voor Apple iPad gebruikers). 
"Top Bun" is een race spel met konijntjes voor spelers vanaf een jaar of 5. Wil jij dit spelletje ook, kies dan het "Top Bun" pledge level (je kunt je huidige pledge aanpassen zolang de kickstarter loopt).

Ik word letterlijk weggeblazen door alle steun die ik vanuit de bordspel gemeenschap mag ontvangen. Vreugde & dankbaarheid strijden in mij om voorrang en ik kan jullie niet genoeg bedanken voor de sympathie en donaties die ik heb ontvangen. 
De kickstarter is net 2 uur in de lucht en we zijn al op de helft. Fantastisch!
Het is geweldig om mee te maken, en dat wilde ik graag met jullie delen.

campaign.story:
Oh my word, thank you for making this project so awesome!
Please take note: There are no late pledges.
If you missed the Kickstarter, don't worry! The game will be widely available in retail this August/September, so you can pick it up there!
It's time to join the adventure! Whether you are a veteran mercenary or this is your first foray into the wilds of Gloomhaven, I am happy to have you on board.
Through this Kickstarter, you can pledge to receive a copy of the second printing of Gloomhaven, complete with new health and experience trackers and a revised rule book and scenario book. Your game will come with miniatures for all the character classes, but you can also purchase extra sets of miniatures and standees.
If you already own the game, you can pledge to receive just the upgraded trackers and revised books. In addition, there is also an all-new mini expansion of 17 solo scenarios available.
 If you want to learn how to play Gloomhaven, these two Gaming Rules! videos are all you need.
Gloomhaven is a series of tactical combat scenarios that are strung together in a persistent, thematic campaign.
Each scenario is played out through rounds of combat against fully automated enemies. In each round, players will play 2 cards to determine the order in which they act and what abilities they perform. Each card has 2 special actions, and on their turn, players can perform the top action of one card and the bottom action of the other.
Card actions are varied and powerful, cutting through the monotony of a basic "move and attack" system. Default actions are available, though, if a player's plans get ruined by an enemy's ability card or even by the actions of their own teammates. Gloomhaven eliminates the alpha player through simultaneous hidden action selection to illustrate the chaos of battle.
Photo courtesy of Jinha Yoon
There are also no dice in Gloomhaven. Instead, attacks are modified by a player's attack deck. Over time, this attack deck will change as a player begins to add and remove cards by completing battle goals and leveling up, which will also give them access to more powerful, higher level ability cards.
In midst of battle, players will also need to focus on looting money tokens. These can be used to purchase useful items in town, where new stock is always being unlocked by player actions.
As players interact with the town through events and move along the branching story paths of the world, they will always be working towards completing personal quests. By meeting certain objectives, a player's character will retire, unlocking a new character class to play with, new events for parties to encounter, and additional perks for the achieving player. After retirement, a player will create a new character, possibly from the class that was just unlocked, and continue the adventure!
If you'd like to learn more about the game play, you can find a PDF of the rule book here, or you can watch another overview video:
Or a game play video:
Are you ready to start the adventure? Becausewe have started a community-driven expedition that I would love you to participate in.
Just head on over to the first update to find out what it is all about and join in on the adventure. You won't regret it!
If you don't have the physical game in front of you, that's not a problem. There are still plenty of ways to participate. If you own Tabletop Simulator on Steam, each scenario in the community-driven campaign is available as a separate workshop file. (Scenario 1) (Scenario 2) (Scenario 3) (Scenario 4) (Scenario 5) (Scenario 6) (Scenario 7) (Scenario 8) (Scenario 9)
Or you can follow along and watch as the following groups play through the scenarios every third day.
Mike Bennett's YouTube stream is scheduled for 3pm EDT (19:00 GMT).
Alucard's Twitch stream is scheduled for 7pm EDT (23:00 GMT).
If you're just joining us and want to get caught up on the story, you can find everything you need to know here.
Either way, the important thing is that, when you are ready, I want you to vote on what happens next. This campaign is being run by and for you, and I'm just excited to see where it goes!
But the extra adventures don't end when the Kickstarter ends! Starting in November of this year, after everyone has had time to receive their games and enjoy them for a while, we will starting a brand new community driven expedition.
The number of scenarios in the new expedition will be directly tied to this Kickstarter's funding goal. Every $100,000 past $2 million will add a new scenario to the expedition. It's going to be huge!


New to Kickstarter? No problem! The number people pledging to Kickstarter board game projects seems to be getting larger all the time, and we are happy to have you on board. Becoming a backer is very simple. Just follow these steps: \
Step 1: Look through the banner at the top right of this page and click on the reward level you'd like to receive.
Step 2: Choose the correct shipping location and the pledge amount should automatically adjust to the correct value. This step is important!
Step 3: Click the green "Continue" button and then finish filling out your information on the subsequent page.
Step 4: Click "Pledge" and you're done! Welcome to the adventure!
Immediately after I was finished working on Gloomhaven, I realized I wasn't done with the world. I wanted to make a set of scenarios specifically designed for strategic solo play - scenarios that would highlight the strengths and weaknesses of each class and force players to really get under the hood and learn to play each class masterfully.
PDFs of these scenarios and the accompanying item rewards are already available online, but now you can pledge $10 to receive a printed version. This includes a 24-page scenario book of 17 all-new solo scenarios and a deck of 17 item cards - rewards for completing each of the missions.
The solo scenarios are not included in the base box, but you can add $10 to you pledge to receive them in addition.
Strictly for those who already own the game, we are offering four health and experience trackers and revised rule and scenario books. These are already included in the reprint pledge, but are upgrades from the original version.
You can get the four dials for $7, the upgraded books for $15, and if you'd like the solo scenarios as well, you can bundle all three offers for $25.
PDFs of the new rule book and scenario book are also available online.
And if you are interested, you can order some cool third-party stuff like removable stickers from Sinister Fish Games and a nice wooden insert from Meeple Realty.
The second printing of Gloomhaven comes with a full set of miniatures for each of the 17 character classes. These add-ons are not needed, but if, for whatever reason, you want additional sets of miniatures or standees, you can add $20 to your pledge for additional sets of minis and $5 for additional sets of standees.
Be forewarned that while the miniatures box comes spoiler-free, the standees will be delivered as a single bare punch-board and may ruin the surprise of some of the unlocked character images.
Gloomhaven is a big, heavy game, so you will need to pay shipping on every copy that you order. The good news is that the cost of shipping to the US is already included and subsidized elsewhere. The price for shipping in other regions per game box is listed in the first column.
The second column is the price of shipping when ordering up to six other items (this includes sets of HP/XP dials, the book upgrades, the solo scenarios, sets of miniatures, or sets of standees). The upgrade combo pack is considered three items. If you pledge for more than six items, you will need to pay the second column shipping price again.
There's more good news, though. If you order a copy of Gloomhaven and want to add to your pledge the solo scenarios and/or a set of standees, those items are small enough to fit into the game's shipping box, so you won't have to pay any additional shipping on them - just the one shipping price for the main box itself.
All of these shipping costs are added automatically when you pledge, but if you add more onto you pledge for additional items, you will have to add the additional shipping costs yourself.
Unfortunately, I made some mistakes when setting up the initial pledge levels. If you live in the following countries, please use the alternate pledge levels (labeled DE and SG) to get the correct shipping price: Germany, Singapore, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Romania, Slovakia, and Slovenia. Sorry for the confusion!
Please note! Shipping is US, Canada, China, and EU-friendly! You will not have to pay customs if you are in these regions.
While pledging $1 won't get your name into every copy of Gloomhaven, it will get you into my personal copy of Gloomhaven.
That's right, I am going to take a sharpie to as many of my components as necessary to commemorate the names of everyone who pledges $1 or adds $1 to their pledge. Not only that, but I'll shoot a video of the whole sordid, game-defacing thing. It will be wonderful.
Isaac is the driving force behind Cephalofair Games, which published its first game, Forge War, three years ago, and its second game, Gloomhaven, was released to much acclaim in February. Isaac also designed and developed these games and is basically a one-man publishing army. He writes a weekly blog about board game publishing, design and whatever else he is thinking about at www.cephalofair.com.
Isaac graduated two years ago with a physics PhD, but now works full-time designing and publishing games. He is very happy.
Josh McDowell started playing board games after his wife encouraged him to find an inexpensive hobby. The joke is on her, as that encouragement turned into an expansive collection and regular schedule of playing games with his friends. He turned to his graphic design prowess to offset the costs and is now completely engrossed in all things board games. He lives in Indiana with his wife and three young children, gamers in the making. You can find his portfolio at www.behance.net/mcscowl.
Alexandr lives in Ukraine, Odessa and works as a freelancer and specializes in several styles: sci-fi, cyberpunk and fantasy. He's looking for hard-core projects in the styles that he likes. Most of all he is proud of his artwork for cards in board games. He dreams to release his comics and develop the indie game with a small group of people In the future. You can see his portfolio at http://kotnonekot.deviantart.com.
James Van Schaik has over 20 years experience as a professional miniature sculptor. He has worked as a freelance sculptor, in-house staff sculptor and on several exclusivity contracts for a range of companies including Megacon Games, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ral Partha, WizKids, Wyrd, Games Workshop, Pulp City, Battlefront, Gale Force 9, Dust Tactics, Mantic, Reaper, and RAFM.
He has also sculpted for toy companies outside of the gaming industry and produced figures for licensed properties such as Lord of the Rings, Dr. Who, Marvel, DC, and Harry Potter to name a few. You can find him on facebook at https://www.facebook.com/james.schaik?fref=ts or see his portfolio at https://www.flickr.com/photos/24546626@N04.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Coming into this reprint Kickstarter, I am in the unique position of knowing exactly what it takes to publish this 21-pound monstrosity.

The experience of the first printing for me, Josh, and the factory will prove incredibly useful. We are proofing files as you read this, and we're hoping to get the printers fired up before the campaign even ends.

Though some components are being updated, and other components are being added, none of that will provide much of a delay at all. Based on the previous run, once the printing starts, we are expecting two months for production and two months for shipping, getting you your game in August if everything goes well.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The Gloomhaven sequel is live on Kickstarter, now with a free challenge coin for returning backers
updates.update_content:
Hello! I hope you are having a great Monday! You haven't heard from me in a while, but I just want to let you know, in case you weren't aware, that the Kickstarter for Frosthaven - the giant, big-box sequel to Gloomhaven - is live on Kickstarter right now.
You can head over to the page to see all the details, but I did want to let you in on something extra special we're not yet highlighting on the page. As a previous backer of Cephalofair Games on the second printing of Gloomhaven, you will automatically get a free challenge coin in your Frosthaven box if you back that too. We're still working on getting a physical sample of it, but here is a rough rendering:

Greeting residents of Gloomhaven!
Another quick update here pointing you in the direction of the second scenario in the Infinite Beyond Expedition: Gas Giants, which was released today.
You can find a PDF of the scenario here, and a printer-friendly PDF here.
If you have questions about the scenario, it is best if you post them in the BGG thread here.

Hey there, residents of Gloomhaven!
Just throwing out a quick update to let you know that the third community-driven expedition has started. All the  info can be found in the BGG thread, but here are the pertinent files as well:
Intro and first scenario

Hey there, residents of Gloomhaven!
It has been a while. Last time we talked, I mentioned that the community-driven scenario would launch, at the earliest, at the end of September. Well, that date has passed, but I finally have a fully formed plan that I am ready to share with you!
Community-driven expedition

Greetings residents of Gloomhaven!
I hope everything is going well with you! It has certainly been a while since we wrapped up the last community-driven expedition, so I wanted to give you an update on where we are with the next one, since my last estimate on when it would begin would be "after Gen Con," and it is indeed after Gen Con.
I must admit, though, that the other main reason I am contacting you is to tell you about Quiver Gaming Gear's Kickstarter for officially licensed . So I'll talk more about those below, but first let's talk about that expedition.

Hello residents of White Oak,
Sorry for the lack of update last week. As always you can keep up to date on this expedition by subscribing to this geek list. It is apparently a little more reliable than me.
This expedition will end with scenario 10 in two weeks. Of course, I've promised you another 10 after that, and I just wanted to let you know that there will be a break between these 10 and those 10. I'm not sure exactly when the next expedition will start, but I'll try to get that figured out in the next couple weeks. I'm leaning towards starting it .

Hello there, residents of White Oak,
Another week, another scenario for the community driven expedition! I thought it would be interesting to shift perspectives on this weeks city event, just to highlight the ridiculousness of what is going on. It turned out to be a close vote, but now we've got a somewhat sympathetic guard on our side.

Greetings residents of White Oak!
Just stopping by to drop off the latest scenario in the community driven expedition! I really hope you've been enjoying it so far. I've been pretty proud of the last few that have been released. It was my birthday yesterday, so I didn't play test this latest one quite as much as I'd like to, but hopefully you find it challenging and entertaining!

Hey residents of White Oak,
We're going to do a very quick update today, as the scenario took longer to create than I expected and I am running late.
Here are the city events and the new scenario:

Dear residents of White Oak,
Again I bring you the city event released on Monday, where you have escaped down the sewer tunnel and come to a difficult fork in your path.

campaign.story:
We will be relaunching DiverCity in the months to come with better reward structures, early bird price for everyone (no more early bird pledges), a better game, more stretch goals, and a better presentation. You can follow along the relaunch in the update section of this campaign, on the DiverCity Facebook group page, on our BGG Page, or on our official Facebook and Twitter pages.
Prototype version of DiverCity, featuring a guest appearance by BrilliAnts miniatures for testing purposes!
                                                                                                              A diver's rotating base in action
Also included in every copy (Deluxe as well) are all the stretch and social goals we unlock during the campaign.
                                                                                IMPORTANT: We don't use a pledge manager. Thus, backers cannot increase their pledges or adjust shipping fees at the KS prices after the campaign ends. Future pre-orders can be made on our website.
In DiverCity, a team of scientists and divers must unite against corporations which destroy the coral reefs, home to a host of diverse marine species

DiverCity is a balanced cooperative game where every decision matters, and where information sharing is key.
More than 16 different levels of difficulty to choose from enables you to play with anyone and adapt the challenge according to your gaming table. Does your group have what it takes to complete the game on “Legendary level 16”?
The game features a special diving movement system which dictates how the diver miniatures explore the coral reefs and move around the islands (more on that system below).
DiverCity can be played by 1-7 players, ages 10+, and a game lasts roughly 45 minutes to an hour.
The 2 types of cards in the game: Special cards (beneficial), and Event cards (harmful)
One of DiverCity's playable divers -- the Captain
A game of DiverCity revolves around each player having control of a diver, thus, most of your actions and possibilities are oriented toward what your diver does. It is how and in which order you use your actions that will make the cornerstone of your strategy! 
Check out our Beta rulebook as well as the gameplay videos in our Reviews & Videos section below for more information!
This is a cooperative game. Save enough species in the coral reef before the corporations ruin the place to win!
The Bad Guys
The Dynamite fishermen, the Oil Platforms, and the Hotels are the antagonists of Divercity
            ... and more exciting Stretch Goals to come!
BGG Picture
Facebook Post (French version of this post also counts)
Twitter Post
Picture of the double-sided board from the Facebook Social Goal

 DiverCity: QA with Maxime Tardif

DiverCity comes along with free promo packs on Kickstarter (extra cost post-Kickstarter). More details on the content of these packs to be revealed during the campaign.
All of the game's art is complete, apart from some of the incoming kickstarter promos, and has been printed and played with, and shown to people - to great reception!
Similarly, the game has been play-tested a lot by both us, reviewers, and lots of people at various events, and has been praised for its colorful and appealing visuals, dynamic gameplay focusing on interaction, adaptability, and replayability.
DiverCity is accessible to everyone due to its 16+ levels of difficulty, which you can adjust depending on who you’re playing with, and the challenge your group requires. Optional harder rules include not being able to speak when diving (including speaking of in-game strategy for the real masochists out there), and a 7th player playing against all the others in a quest for destruction!
This project is US, Canada, Australia, and EU-friendly, and we shoulder a part of the shipping costs ourselves! (about $10 CAD per location)

Retailers
Retailers are welcome to support this campaign as well, and benefit from the reduced kickstarter price, as well as early availability! If you're a retailer interested in this project, please contact us at spheregamesinc@gmail.com for more information on price and distribution!
One of DiverCity's playable divers -- the Contact Specialist
The diver miniatures have a special rotating base which rotates between 2 states: Surface, and Diving.
When at the surface, divers can move around between tiles, as well as reach islands, close hotels on them, and refill their oxygen tanks.
When In Diving, divers explore coral reefs, discover species, and spend oxygen, which has to be refilled eventually before diving again. Optional, harder rules also make it so players can’t communicate when diving, and for those who wish to push it even further, an optional variant proposes that players can’t even talk any strategy of the game while their diver is underwater!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
DiverCity is our second game on Kickstarter, our first being BrilliAnts/Fourmidable, which was a hard first project to tackle on since it had 93 miniatures, 90 of them with special rotating bases, more than 400 tiles, and 138 cards inside the box. It was an ambitious project, and we had great pressure to ensure that the game's quality would be met.

While we can certainly be proud of the final's game quality (Panda did an amazing job), we did suffer some production delays. We wanted the game to be as good as it could be, and that led to some re-designing of the game, namely the ant miniatures, and especially their special rotating bases, which we had to scrap a few times over since they weren't working quite like we wanted them to.

Which is why we are re-using these bases in part for DiverCity -- because they work incredibly well with the theme of diving in this game, and also to alleviate risks since we know they work now, and that they work very well. We are working again with Panda to deliver a quality product, as we did with BrilliAnts!

The hard part of a Kickstarter is often the fulfillment, which is why we're going to work with the same fulfillment centers and freight companies we have worked with in the past. We were first timers last time, which led to some confusion in setting up some accounts and payment, but it won't happen this time around! We are now very familiar with the process of worldwide fulfillment, so we will be well prepared to tackle on that challenge from day one and lead the games to your doorsteps.

As always, we remain open to any suggestions or help on that matter!

campaign.story:
In a not so distant future, agrochemicals have become a normal practice. The mining industry created toxic wastes, combined to pollution they proved fatal to agriculture. Soon, the first mutated crops unleashed havoc. Water was no longer enough for them, they wanted a protein-rich, juicy steak dinner. We tried to give them our politicians instead of steak, but they just wouldn't eat them… it made them sick.
Though we were tough, not to be frightened by zombie potatoes. We learned to tame our mutated vegetables. The farming profession went from a peaceful activity to a very risky albeit lucrative profession. Those who can sow, water and feed the best crops will become rich. 
It's your turn to go to the fields. The Mutant Crops are waiting... will you dare to harvest them? 
In Mutant Crops you're playing as a farmer who is seeking riches farming some of the most ravenous and dangerous crops the world has ever seen. Mutated from decades of pollution, these aren't your everyday vegetables. 
In this short, simple and fun worker placement game you'll be placing your meeples on spaces in order to perform their actions such as gaining resources, purchasing crops, watering your plants, feeding them the steaks they're craving and competing with other farmers for another space on the board. 

You're collecting resources: seeds, water and steak dinners. Seeds are necessary to purchase plants, and water/meat are necessary to nourish your crops to provide the best return. Crops are not worth anything until they've been watered and/or fed.

The farmer who has the most money at the end of the game can laugh their way to the bank - and the victory circle. 

The game is the ideal filler for worker placement fans who want to have a quick game that still challenge their skills. It's a great introductory game for new players on euro-style games, and plays perfect with kids.

NOTE: PNP Demo and Rulebook aren't final. Both will be improved based on your feedback (Rules) and on stretch goals (Deluxe PNP).
   Note: All previews where made with the prototype box. Final box will be different, and game components quality will be highly improved.
  We'll be working with GamesQuest for fulfillment outside of the US, which will allow us to be EU-friendly. Since the game is under $20, it will also be US, Australia and Canadian-friendly. 
To keep the cost of the game down we're going to send untracked packages, though we'll look into having an add-on in our pledge manager to add tracking after the campaign. 
We love and support FLGS! We're very proud to be able to work with local gaming stores and are glad to have gaming stores working with us to deliver our games to more customers. 

If you operate a retail store and would like to support our project please email info@atherisgames.com for pricing and shipping information. 

Sebas & Rocio
Mutant Crops was designed by Sebastian Koziner and illustrated by Rocio Ogñenovich. We're a married couple consisting of a board game artist (Rocio) and a graphic designer/game design (Sebas). For the last several years we've worked together running OK Art Studio, which has been involved in the art/graphic design of over 10 successful games with clients such as Dr Finn and Pencil First Games. 
We publish our games and comics in Argentina with our publishing studio, OK Ediciones - a pioneer in modern games in our country. Mutant Crops will be our second game published worldwide, our first was called Oni. Oni was published through Kickstarter in 2015 by Treesharp Games. We're really excited to bring Mutant Crops to Kickstarter! 
Atheris Games
Atheris Games is a board game publishing company based out of Orlando, FL. Atheris Games launched Cul-De-Sac Conquest on Kickstarter and were 're proud to bring Mutant Crops to Kickstarter! 
Sebastian worked with Atheris for the graphic design of Cul-De-Sac Conquest and our up-and-coming game Supernatural Socks - when he said he had a game he would like us to publish we of course had to take a look. Though we definitely agreed to look at it because he was so great to work with, we were instantly super impressed with this little worker placement game. Mutant Crops is a great game, and one Atheris is proud to publish. 
We hope you will enjoy it as much as we do! 
Mutant Crops was originally co-published in Argentina by OK Ediciones and El Dragón Azul. We would like to specially thanks to Laura and Witty from El Dragón Azul, they are doing an amazing job publishing games in South America. If you want to know more about their work, please visit their site:
www.eldragonazul.com.ar
Thanks to Federico Fontana for his awesome work translating the rulebook. If you need english/spanish translations, he is your guy!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Atheris Games is well versed in risks and challenges. We've learned an incredible deal from our first campaign for Cul-De-Sac Conquest. We've made a plethora of mistakes and encountered every obstacle that one could think of - which raised our costs, and extended our ship date. 

However, we learned from that and have all the artwork complete and the game ready, so that we can begin manufacturing Mutant Crops as soon as the campaign ends. We also took out some of the campaign pledge levels that added time for Cul-De-Sac. 

Though we're sure we will encounter some mistakes again we feel that we have learned a great deal to prevent them. Also, we have added a more solid buffer in our shipping time to account for any potential problems. 

Furthermore, our transparency with our backers and our communication is of supreme importance to us. For Cul-De-Sac Conquest we delivered thank you cards and stickers to all of our backers who answered our backer survey and continually update the campaign so backers knew everything that they needed to about the progress of the game. 

Despite being late on Cul-De-Sac backers were still constantly reminded that that we were working and doing everything in our power to deliver the best game possible. The same will be true if any unfortunate delays may happen with Mutant Crops.

campaign.story:
Wu Wei Rulebook   |   Wu Wei BGG Page   |   Wu Wei Website   |   Previous Campaign
Lead your student on a journey to earn five animal cards while your master maintains your lineage marker and cultivates chi. Once you have all five animal cards and your lineage marker, you can move your student and master to the center octagon. The first player to do so has successfully passed on their martial arts lineage, and wins the game!
Meanwhile, one player represents the emperor, working to unify the empire by placing towers in the four corners of the board. As the empire expands, the emperor’s forces grow. Recruited generals give the emperor greater power and flexibility but the additional forces require vigilance and careful planning. Generals rely on the emperor or empress to create paths for them across unforgiving terrains. If the emperor places towers in the four corners before one of the other players has passed on their martial arts lineage, the emperor player wins, and only the emperor’s lineage will prevail.
    Wu Wei: Journey of the Changing Path is played in a series of rounds. In each round, players take turns in clockwise order, beginning with the starting player. As the seasons change, a gathering will be triggered every winter, during which turn order is reassigned. The game continues in this way until one player wins.
                      SOLO CAMPAIGN ADDED  
Not only is there going to be a solo campaign but I have enlisted the help of Mike Mullins (a solo gaming enthusiast and experienced developer) to help me put the final touches on the solo version of the game. I'm really excited to have Mike on board. I've spent a lot of time with this game and if there's going to be a solo campaign, it's going to the best is can possibly be!  
"I'm elated to be a part of the development of Wu Wei. The multiplayer game translates incredibly well to solo play. The variable board setup, unique elemental abilities, and the difficulty level I insist upon will surely satisfy my fellow solo gamers." - Mike Mullins  
Mike Mullins is a longtime playtester and developer, best known for the creation of solo modes for games such as Castle Dice, Lagoon, and Compounded. He's the designer of Buttonshy's solo game Pentaquark, as well as the co-designer of Bottom of the 9th. He's also done solo modes for Fleet: Wharfside, Ahead in the Clouds, and Circle the Wagons and he's on the Board of Directors for Unpub, the Unpublished Games Network (Unpub.net). 
  Undead Viking Videos Review
"Wu Wei presents the players with fun and interesting choices and it has a very open feel to it. I never felt hemmed in. I felt like I was on a journey with my student and master but I never felt like a had to go on a certain path. And ultimately, is the game fun? Yeah! It is a lot of fun! If you are a fan of the martial arts world and clever path finding games you should check this out." - Lance Myxter, Undead Viking Videos
Doug & Doug Gaming Play Through
We had WEI too much fun with this one *wink wink*... no but seriously, this is an amazing game and a must have for your collection! - Doug & Doug Gaming
GeekDad Preview
"Wu Wei is one of those games that will attract passersby at a convention just because it looks so elaborate when it’s all set up. If you’re a fan of abstract strategy or if you want to see a martial arts game that isn’t about flying kicks and throwing punches but digs deeper into the philosophy, Wu Wei is certainly worth checking out. It’s perhaps not a game for everyone—you do have to have patience learning the rules and how to read the board and trackers—but I think it is rewarding for those who are, ahem, disciplined enough to master it." - Jonathan Liu, GeekDad.com
Preview from GeekDad by Jonathan Liu
  "Wu Wei is a rare game with the elegance of an abstract, yet every detail contains deep meaning. Each game feels dynamic with a simple resource system ensuring that advantage flows between the players, and with three variants the game grows with your mastery of it. I've enjoyed the already beautiful prototype of Wu Wei and I can't wait to play the final gorgeous production." 
Teal Fristoe
Designer of Corporate America and Shadow Throne

updates.update_userinfo: Wu Wei is on a boat!
updates.update_content:
Howdy Backers!
I am pleased to tell you that Wu Wei is on a boat headed for San Francisco! This game has been a long time coming but it's finally on the way!

Howdy Backers!  

The dice arrived at the factory on time! Unfortunately, the wood pieces are running behind schedule. Apparently it has been unseasonably rainy in the area of China where the wood is being produced so they are taking a little extra time to let the wood and paint dry. We're talking about the signature pieces of the game so I'm glad that they are focused on quality but it has pushed the schedule a bit. The games won't leave China until September 7th. Please see the revised shipping schedule below. I know! It's hard to wait three more weeks for this baby to be in your hands. Please hang tight. I think you'll be happy with the final result.

Howdy folks!
Things are moving forward slowly but surely! The final components (15,000 dice) will be delivered to the PandaGM factory in Shenzhen, China on August 10th. The games will be assembled and put on a container ship headed for San Francisco by August 20th. Ocean shipping and clearing customs will take 2-3 weeks and then the games will be delivered from the port to my distributor via truck.

Howdy Backers!
The last items are in production (wood tiles and player pieces). After that, the games will be assembled and shipped from the PandaGM factory in Shenzhen, China. As soon as I have more information, I will update you with firm dates for delivery and hopefully a few more pictures.

Happy Holidays Backers!!!
We are really starting to pick up the pace with Wu Wei. I sent in all the final digital files to PandaGM and went through their exhaustive "Design Verification" process. The files have all passed with flying colors and have been sent to the factory team in Shenzhen, China. They are now creating a "Digital Proofs" of all the artwork. You've just entered your food truck into the "Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy" competition hoping to be crowned the Food Truck Titan. Over the next 5 days, you'll send your team of food trucks to various locations trying to score sweet parking spots at lucrative venues. The player with the most sales after five days takes home the title of Food Truck Titan.  Pick Venues, Roll Dice, Play Actions, Get Paid!
THE TRUCKS

SHIPPING
We came through on UK /  EU-Friendly rewards on our last project and didn't tell anybody.  Now we're confident in the process. We'll use a fulfillment company to eliminate VAT for UK and EU backers.  Each country has received the same subsidized shipping discount of $4.
STRETCH GOALS

               THE GAME 
Players have a team of food trucks matching each venue. Each round, players secretly select and reveal two venues to sell their grub.
  Players select actions to play this round, and then play them clockwise one at a time hoping to better their chances at a fat payout.
  At the end of a round, the customers are split evenly between # of trucks. Any remainder is discarded. Food trucks return to players and actions are discarded from the game.
TWO PLAYER VARIANT
 WHY KICKSTARTER?
If we reach our goal, we will be able to pay for the manufacturing and shipping of Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy. Manufacturing is lined up. Artwork files will be shipping to the printer shortly after the project. All that is left is the funding.  
We're still small, and we love Kickstarter because it puts us directly in contact with incredible people willing to help build something they believe in. We're engaged with the community attending events and meetups around the midwest including Gen Con four years in a row.  We feel energized by these connections and building trust within the community. We reward our supporters with discounts on the game and free flowing communication with us the creators. As a backer, you'll be a copilot and chef on this journey to create awesome games.
PAST PROJECTS
In February 2015, we raised $36,078 on Kickstarter with our first game, Brewin' USA. This game takes place at the inception of the craft beer revolution. Players auction over brewing ingredients, brew their signature line of craft beers, and compete for city and regional area control! The game has continued to grow including selling out of inventory at GenCon 2016. This project was a wonderful ride and we owe a huge thanks to our backers.  
Brewin' USA (Kickstarter)
Brewin' USA website
Brewin' USA (Amazon)
MEET THE DESIGNER
From Ryan Lambert - I started gaming when I was little, especially with my Dad. We played the standards like Monopoly, Risk, Pay Day, and Careers. Eventually, we discovered games like Catan and Agricola and the collection has gotten out of hand since then. My favorite game right now is Pandemic Legacy. It’s cliche, but the experience is just too good. A close second would be Imperial Assault or Blood Rage. 
I started designing games a couple years ago because I love to create and explore themes and mechanics. Truck Off started with theme. Food trucks are abundant in the Twin Cities and the idea of owning one has always appealed to me. After so many iterations, I love how clean the design of Truck Off ended up with a good mix of strategy and luck. It’s a great casual game that scales well for groups and I hope you have as much fun with it as I have.
MEET THE PROJECT CREATOR
Still a small outfit, Adam and Chris from Adam's Apple Games are eager to continue to grow in the gaming industry.  We're engaged in this community, and will continue to deliver awesome projects and give our commitment and energy back in return. We write our final rules in as a female lead player. Check us out from Gen Con 2016, and we're pumped to announce we'll be back at Gen Con 2017! 
MEET THE ARTIST
John Ed de Vera on Instagram
John specializes in a unique paper craft artwork style.  This means literally cutting paper and then photographing his work.  This is a super unique style that captures depth and shadows making his pieces look unbelievably real.  He is a master at his craft, hands down.
More artwork on the way soon!

campaign.story:
The Shared Dream is a 1-4 player cooperative board game set in the world of ODAM Publishing's tabletop RPG Of Dreams And Magic. It sees a group of each characters wake up from the exact same terrible dream, only to discover it's coming to life in the real world.
Each time the game is played, a Shared Dream scenario is chosen, with each one providing a different set of objectives, enemy mechanics, and unique Nemesis. Every Shared Dream also contains its own set of Personal Reflections, mini-stories each character must progress through in order to contribute to winning the scenario.
With 4 Shared Dream scenarios to choose from, 6 unique player characters, and a modular city that changes with every playthrough, The Shared Dream combines the strategy and replayability of a board game with the mood, theme, and storyline of a RPG.
    Download the Rules Here!  
Combining the storytelling of an RPG with the strategy of a board game, The Shared Dream contains 2 main mechanics that push the game forward.  
First is the Personal Reflection deck. At the beginning of each game, every player randomly chooses a Personal Reflection deck that is tied to the specific Shared Dream scenario they have chosen to play. This Personal Reflection deck tells the story of that individual's part of the Shared Dream, and their efforts to combat it in the Waking World. Each Personal Reflection deck sees players travel throughout the city, speak with its denizens, and face challenges and obstacles as they work towards completing their part of The Shared Dream.
The reflections of your dreams are the key to ending this nightmare.
The second is personal resource management. Every player can only take 3 actions per turn, so they must carefully consider how they are going to best spend their time. Do they rush through their Personal Reflection, helping to reach the final conflict as soon as possible? Do they carefully manage their resources to help slow the tide of enemies? Or do they go all out and defeat everything they can, despite the risks?
In addition to their actions, the main resource players use is Conviction. Conviction is used to channel their dream identities, helping them grow temporarily stronger, gain access to special powers, and defeat their enemies. Unfortunately, every time Conviction is spent, a character's Nightmare track is increased. At the end of every turn, players must roll a Nightmare check that grows harder the more Nightmare they have.  
Once this Nightmare check is failed, that player spawns a new enemy whose strength is dictated by the amount of Nightmare the player has. In this way, players must always consider when and how to use their Conviction. While spending 3 Conviction to channel at full power may be helpful now, it will inevitably have consequences down the line.
To see more of The Shared Dream in action, check out these videos! 
                       *Please note that the Alternate Animus promo cards do not add an additional scenario to the Crux Collection.
                      To include an add-on, after you pledge, click on the blue "manage my pledge" button. On the next page, you will see your current pledge total. Add the amount of the add-on you want to the current amount, and hit "confirm". Once the campaign has completed, we will gather more information as necessary.
This full set of Conviction and Nightmare themed custom dice comes with 4 blue Over dice and 4 red Under dice. Just add $5 to your pledge.
All returning backers receive a free set of custom dice!  
The Crux Collection adds 6 unique solo scenarios, each of which will help immerse you in the lore of The Shared Dream. 
The Crux Collection will grow along with the rest of this project! Any additional characters unlocked through Stretch Goals will also add a playable solo story to The Crux Collection.
When a vicious Blood Drinker savagely hunts throughout the city, only the curse of the Moon Beast can stop it! Every night phase, players gain a chance to become the vicious Moon Beast, the only force strong enough to directly confront the Blood Drinker.
The Blood Drinker and Moon Beast can also be used as new characters to play any Shared Dream Scenario.
Darker still is the inclusion of a new Reaver type, the Malefic. Created by an abundance of Shadows, the Malefic floods the city with enemies, requiring everyone to handle the new threat.
The Malefic can be used to greatly increase the challenge of any Shared Dream scenario.
The Shared Dream's take on the zombie genre! When there's no more room in your head, the dead will walk the earth! Featuring a brand new Nemesis, the Necromancer, Necrophobia sees players deal with an onslaught of undead enemies guided by a dark sorcerer's hand.
If you are adding Necrophobia to the Ultimate Edition, Dreaming in Bulk, or a discounted Ultimate Edition (if you are a returning backer), please adjust your pledge by $20 ($100 for Dreaming in Bulk) to receive Necrophobia! 
The Horned Horror of Laruna lays waste to the Waking World in the Wrath of Axitath! This add-on introduces the new "Wrath of Axitath" scenario to The Shared Dream and includes the 85mm tall Axitath miniature!
Save some cash when you back The Shared Dream and its 3 initial addons! Just choose "The Ultimate Collection" as your pledge level. The Ultimate Collection does NOT include the Of Dreams and Magic RPG, the Necrophobia expansion, or the Axitath expansion.
Go All-In on The Shared Dream! This backer level gets you The Shared Dream, all stretch goals, and all of its expansions!
Whether you're a RPG vet adding to their collection, or a first-time RPG player, take your game beyond the board with a copy of Of Dreams And Magic.
  Shipping will be handled AFTER the Kickstarter is complete. Since we have multiple add-ons and stretch goals, we cannot fairly offer a single shipping cost to every backer.
To help minimize shipping costs, we will be subsidizing $15 worth of shipping on every package, regardless of size.
We will also be shipping from multiple fulfillment centers around the globe to help reduce costs and manage shipping in the most streamlined way possible.
We will be handling post-campaign management through Backerkit, and fulfillment through FulfillRite in the US and Canada, and Happyshops in Europe. We also enjoy an existing fulfillment relationship with Amazon, giving us even further options to ensure we can provide an optimum fulfillment solution for every backer.
Below is our ESTIMATE of shipping costs for the base game. Our current estimates do not show a shipping cost difference between the base game and the Ultimate Edition.  These costs may change based on stretch goals unlocked and additional add-ons purchased.
Please note that you can save on shipping by selecting the Dreaming in Bulk pledge level! When backing at the Dreaming in Bulk level, all 6 copies will be shipped to one location with shipping paid only once!
If you are a retailer interested in carrying The Shared Dream, please send us a message on Kickstarter or email john@odampublishing.com for pricing and other information.
Please refer to the latest update on the original campaign (found here!) for more information before you back!
  The Shared Dream will be manufactured by WinGo Games
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We originally launched a Kickstarter for The Shared Dream in November of 2016. Soon after we launched, we received revised manufacturing quotes which opened up a lot of possibilities for us.

We believe this relaunch presents less risk than our initial campaign because we have been able to listen to a lot of backer feedback on ways to advance the campaign and make The Shared Dream better.

This feedback has lead to new add-ons, a lower goal, a lower base price, and more video content. 

Finally, we've been very conservative with our delivery goal. Our true hope is to have The Shared Dream ready to ship by August, but we're well aware that there are many factors at play when it comes to fulfilling board games, and some of those factors are out of our control. We believe this extra 4 month buffer will be enough time to react to any issues that come up along the way.

campaign.story:
Several tribes are laying claim to a set territory. There's only so many resources to go around, and each tribe wants them for themselves. There's a war on, and only one group will win!
Native Wars is a competitive card and dice game, where players manage their tribe decks to capture the most territories. Players' cards are numbered in which you have to roll two dice to activate them by the total sum of your roll. Their card effects guide your tactical actions in the game through manipulating cards in play, attacking the enemy, or granting war power. 
You want to be the first tribe to capture two out of the five territories to win the game. To do this, card placement is vital along with using your 2 actions per turn wisely. Who will you send out into the battlefield? 
NATIVE WARS FEATURES OVER 100+ CARDS & COMPONENTS
                                                                  Why did we choose the theme? We became fascinated with the resilient and hard working communities of the Native Americans. We were lucky enough to volunteer on a reservation in South Dakota and learn more about the past history of these great people. We encourage anyone to check out any volunteer opportunities and see where you can help out.

campaign.story:
Experience pinball from the pinball's point of view. It's not as easy as it looks! 
In Pinball Showdown players are the pinball steering into a wide array of playfield devices while trying to score combinations, activate Wizard Mode and become the highest scoring pinball. To do this they must maintain a critical balance between speed and control. Go too slow and it will limit what you can score and put you at risk for draining, but go too fast and you may lose control!
 
During Pinball Showdown players compete to score playfield devices by using their limited supply of control to direct their pinball but, players also have to consider their pinball's speed as each device has minimum speed requirement needed to score it. Players have only 20 tokens which represent both control and speed flipping back and forth between the two. On top of all that, players are trying to outmaneuver each other in order to score sweet combination bonuses and time things so that when Wizard Mode kicks in they are poised to score the most valuable playfield devices.
If you are interested in reading the rulebook, it can be found HERE
You can try it out too as a free totally no frills Print and Play can be found HERE

campaign.story:
Miss Allison and Lord Brett flee from the burly Behemoth!
Blimey! You and your blokes have been banished and stripped of everything but a few shillings and table scraps. Undaunted, you journey to a strange land to reinvent yourself and reclaim your honor! Will you farm the earth, fight as knights or finagle your own feudums? Your fate is in your hands. (And for better or worse, the hands of a steely-eyed monarch named Queen Anne).
Hailed as "articulate and inventive," Feudum is a deeply nuanced game for 2-5 players that rewards resource management and skillful planning. Six uniquely powered characters and multiple paths to victory make for an ever-changing, open-world experience each time you play!
Feudum mechanics include action programming, area influence, hand management and a unique economic ecosystem. The game features the kinds of strategic complexities found in deeper games such as Terra Mystica, Brass, Caylus and Dominant Species. Jamey Stegmaier (designer of Scythe) compared the game in "depth and aesthetics to Trickerion,” while Jeremy and David of Man Vs Meeple likened it to Vinhos, the Gallerist and Madeira saying, there's a lot of thinking but "in the most fun way possible!"
With many strategies at their disposal, players optimize four actions per turn in an attempt to score the most veneration points over five epochs. Each player controls several medieval characters that roam the countryside tending farms, taxing towns and taking outposts in an effort to rise in power.
But, that’s only the tip of the behemoth's horn! You will also compete to acquire coveted feudums, which increase your membership status in one of six guilds. But beware! Feudum owners must pay homage to the king through military service, or face the charge of disloyalty. Long live the King!
