Justin Schultz & Mark Swanson
Game Designer
Professor by day and game designer by night, I live in Columbia, Missouri with my three splendid daughters. I was Inspired by Eurostyle games in the late 90s and became a fan of legends like Reiner Knizia, Klaus Teuber, Martin Wallace and Andreas Seyfarth. I unveiled my prototype of Feudum at GenCon 2014 and was thrilled to meet and gain insight from folks like Eric Lang, Mike Eliott, Bruno Faidutti and Jamey Stegmaier. I am excited that the game has been hailed as "articulate and inventive," and appears on several "watch" lists within the BoardGameGeek community. I sincerely hope the kickstarter community feels the same way. Check out facebook.com/feudum or BoardGameGeek to learn more.
Artist
As he likes to put it, Justin Schultz is an "earthling living in Jackson, Mississippi." Justin studied graphic design at Mississippi State University and worked for a number of advertising agencies before focusing on concert posters, album covers, package design and, just recently, board game art! His distinctive style of populating his art with monsters, reptiles and robots conjures up memories of children's picture books, albeit slightly skewed. Justin explains that he likes to lure viewers in with "superficially charming images," but then reveal something more "heartbreaking" or "daunting" upon closer inspection.  In 2010, Justin started his independent studio, The Flying Chair

How it Works
A short time after the campaign is over, you will receive an email from Backerkit that directs you to a pledge manager where you can confirm or upgrade your pledge, and add base games, expansions or other “add-ons.” (PayPal accepted). Shipping will be calculated at that time. Backerkit turns overpledges into a credit that may be used as you see fit in the pledge manager.

The rates below are good faith estimates and reflect actual current carrier rates (FedEx, UPS) plus freight. QM Logistics will be shipping from their international fulfillment centers local to backers so that backers avoid VAT.

Rest of the World Fulfillment
QM logistics is dedicated to finding the most cost-effective delivery solution for backers around the world, therefore, the “Rest of World” rate is merely an averaged estimate. Bulk Shipping
Heavier rates will generally just be a multiple or combination of 50lb and under rates. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Truth be told, there will undoubtedly be a smattering of bumps, hiccups and faux pas made on this maiden voyage of ours. It is, after all, the first game that Justin and I have created. Deftly navigating the rough waters of fulfillment houses, freight shippers, manufacturers and backer relations won't be easy. 

Our naiveté is bound to try someone's patience at some point in this adventure. That said, my artist and I are indubitably marked by an old-fashioned, yet noble code of conduct: We always try to do the right thing. 

Of course, to do the right thing, one must have knowledge. Thanks to a treasure trove of books, online resources and the generous support of the game designer community, we both feel quite prepared to take on this challenge. 

Additionally, we have invested time and money in key partnerships that will streamline all operations. Backerkit will facilitate backer orders; OTX will ensure that freight shipping goes off without a hitch; Fulfillment houses like Fulfillrite, Spiral Galaxy, Starlit, Aetherworks and SFC will allow games to ship from within backers' countries of origin. 

So far, these partnerships have been marked by transparency and free-flowing communication, right down to the way cardboard boxes and bubble wrap will be used to ensure the safe transport of every game. 

At first, Odd Bird Games was like a methane gas-sniffing canary trapped deep within the bowels of a coal mine. But, by good fortune, we escaped up the shaft towards the light. And now, with your help....we will fiercely flutter toward the heavens.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

"From ancient times, the Constellations above us have been deemed responsible of a great part of man's destiny, and have been asked for guidance or blessings".
Glow in the dark Constellation Dice were designed last year and found encouraging success. It's originality has been recognized by the world record holder dice collector Mr. Kevin Cook, and the project is going to be featured in the art photo book "Dice – Rendezvous with Randomness" by Måns Danneman (to be soon published by Åskfågeln).
They are still in demand, but not many are left. This campaign will provide good company to your First Edition Ptolemaic Constellation Dice (Northern Sky), while offering new backers the chance to grab the very last available First Edition, along with all new designs.
This campaign has been in the making for one year... 
 ...Have you got space in your collection? 
Please note: The rewards launched when the campaign started do not include the dice unlocked with Stretch Goals. Suggested rewards for new backers are:
€9 Sample Dice Colors (4 dice, 3 options)
€18 Cartographer's Bundle (8 dice, 2 options)
€24 Astronomer's Polyhedral set (9 dice)
€35 Collector's Night Black Polyhedral set (12 dice)
€65 Master's SUPERSAVER Bundle (30 dice)
€24 Astronomer's Polyhedral set
To get one of all available dice versions (design / color / finishing) select the €22 One Deluxe Anniversary Set and increase your pledge by €30 to upgrade it with polyhedrals and the Northern Sky dice in light blue color.
Most rewards over €22 are sent with tracked shipping, but that does not reach all destinations (e.g. Australia, Norway...). If your nation is missing in the list, and you are ok with untracked shipping, please contact me because it may be possible to ship that way.
All dice will be precision engraved (not silkscreened) for maximum durability.
Now available... the full polyhedral set:
The sets will be made in a limited edition of only 500 sets per color, unless sufficient funding allows for a larger manufacturing quantity.
€24 Astronomer's Polyhedral set
  Celebrating 450 Years of Discovery and Exploration
2017 will mark the 40th anniversary of the Voyager spacecrafts, that allowed us to admire Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and now are travelling out of the solar system.  
It is interesting to point out that "Voyager" actually means a traveller to a distant land (especially one who travels by sea) as 2017 will also be the uncelebrated 450th anniversary of the European exploration of the Southern Hemisphere.
In 1567 Álvaro de Mendaña de Neira reached the Solomon Islands, and very soon afterwards a new set of constellations was created to help navigators, and honor new instruments of science such as the pendulum clock and the telescope. 
The first new dice will be 16mm d6 like the one before, showing the constellations of the Southern Hemisphere (including the Southern Cross), and the Magellanic Clouds. A glow-in-the-dark option of Constellation Dice is available.
Rendering of Southern Sky Constellation Dice
Due to incredibly high demand and overwhelming positive feedback, and since a new color has been added to the available options, also the original limited edition Ptolemaic Constellation (Northern Sky) Dice will be reprinted IN THE NEW COLOR ONLY.
Rendering of Northern Sky Constellation Dice (new color)
If you choose Morning Sky color for your Constellation Dice, half will be Southern Sky, while the other half will be Northern Sky.
If you want a mixed set, to add more dice to your reward select one option from the list available in the FAQ at the bottom of this page:
"What are the available options to get Extra Dice?".
I have added a convenient €6 one to obtain both Constellation Dice finishing (standard and glow-in-the-dark).
Optional glow-in-the-dark finish for all versions.
In the following years, as a result of improvements Galileo Galilei made to the telescope, with a magnifying capability of 20×, he was able to see celestial bodies more distinctly than was ever possible before. This allowed Galilei to discover in either December 1609 or January 1610 what came to be known as the Galilean moons. 
The second new dice will be a couple of d10 featuring the planets, and all their 9 moons discovered before 1700 only by using optical means.
These dice do not glow in the dark. Prototypes should be ready soon. Update: if you get a total of at least four Solar System Voyager d10 (in your chosen reward, or by pledging extra), one couple will glow-in-the-dark. This doesn't apply for retailers bundles.
Rendering of Voyager Dice (planets d100, moons d10)
At zero sides you'll see the sun and our moon. Pluto is still included as the ninth planet, although it is now classified as a dwarf planet (one in a growing series). 
The third new dice will be a 16mm d6 with little stars that can be used as pips counting from 1 to 6, while the big sparkling stars, spanning two sides each, make the dice compatibile with Fudge/FATE, for those who play by that ruleset (please check update #6 to learn more about Fudge).
These dice do not glow in the dark. Prototypes should be ready soon.
Although they feature no recognizable constellations, these dice can be used as a background starfield to Constellation Dice, while allowing to reproduce your favourite asterism... as sung in the first inspiration of this project, Björk's song "Desired Constellation":
The manufacturing of the dice will start in January 2017 as soon as the funds and the surveys are collected. According to the factory schedule, about three months would be needed for completing the order, which is much more complex than the initial plan of making only a couple of dice types in two colors. The sorting and packaging of the dice should take two weeks, and shipment about three weeks, allowing for delivery a couple months before the Voyagers' anniversary in August 2017.

The Deluxe versions include also glow-in-the-dark dice, along with the Scout's Bundles, the Master's SUPERSAVER Bundle and the Cartographer's Bundle which offer a partial, inexpensive selection of the available dice. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am an experienced designer and this is my second crowdfunding campaign. The first one was delivered in time with regular updates and positive comments from happy backers at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/constellation-dice

For our german backers:
http://bit.ly/GermanConstellationDice1
http://bit.ly/GermanConstellationDice2
http://bit.ly/GermanConstellationDice3 (this one has pictures)

The designs for this new project are ready and all fees and expenses have been taken into account, with a little margin for unexpected ones.

As soon as they are ready I shall receive and publish here pictures of the actual prototypes of the dice (the main image shows renderings, and your feedback is welcome, so it is possible the final product will appear slightly different).

A quality output is expected because the bulk of the manufacturing will be taken care of by Q Workshop in Poland. This includes the d10 Voyager Dice and the Southern Sky Constellation Dice. The d6 Desired Constellation Dice will be manufactured in China with a custom mold, to allow the special design crossing the corners.

The main risk in a project like this is delays, but I have already taken into account one spare month. If all goes well, you will receive your rewards well in advance of the Voyagers' 40th anniversary in August, but probably later than the reported date of April 2017 (which didn't take into account the Stretch Goal manufacturing of full polyhedral sets).

The second risk is that some envelope may get lost during shipping. 
Untracked shipping is quite safe, inexpensive and reaches more locations. I have successfully sent hundreds of rewards this way last year. If anyway an envelope gets lost I will only be able to provide a proof of shipping, and tracking up to the moment it leaves the italian borders; for this reason I have provided the option for tracked shipping on more costly rewards.

It is your choice to pick tracked or untracked shipping, as I will not be able to resend more than a few packages (first come, first served) given the very limited budget I could allocate for that.
I will do my best to help as usual, and I will try to locate both tracked and untracked shippings, as often it is just a matter of time before they arrive. Anyway I won't be able to resend/refund everyone in the unlikely event that a relevant number of packages is lost.

Please note that most the rewards destined to the U.S.A. shall be shipped with tracking from inside the country, making the risk even less.

The main challenge at the moment is to reach enough backers to reach all the Stretch Goals, the sooner the better.

I trust you with this :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Papercraft fun is coming your way!
updates.update_content: New Year's holidays are great for relax and family fun, so I'm happy to share with you the finished set of glueless papercraft templates, including many surprises!
“The explorer who will not come back or send back his ships to tell his tale is only an adventurer.” Ursula K. Le Guin

Exactly 40 years ago today, the Voyager 2 probe started its journey towards the exploration of the solar system, becoming the only spacecraft to study all four of the solar system's giant planets up close, and also providing amazing photographs in addition to scientific data.  
This is not always the case, as it's usually easier to construct an image based on the available data, than go up there and snap a picture. And that's what your fellow backer Jess Dempsey and I did to honor this peculiar day.

The very last batch of envelopes is now in the hands of the kind and competent team at the central dispatchment postal office nearby the airport. Several trips were necessary in order to clear all the formalities, including having their stamp on every single new (one of 450) freshly printed invoice, that I had to redo in a simpler standardized format in order to be more easily understandable by customs.
All in all it's been a very demanding process due to the fact that every envelope had a different content. I am glad that I was able to successfully allow a valuable amount of customization for all your orders, but due to the long tail of time and effort that this kind of flexibility has brought in, I guess next time things shall be much more streamlined ;)
The new arrivals have been split in hundreds of bags and labelled. Next step will be to assign them to your envelopes. In the meanwhile... enjoy this view of Ursa Major!

It took 50 updates, but at last all the dice have been collected, and they are beautiful!
They will be immediately split in sets, packaged and assigned to your envelopes, but unfortunately this will take a few more days. Everything else is in good order.
I am told that the shipping has been delayed by a wide ransomware attack that halted the courier's tracking system, and in fact their computers were off both times that I visited the warehouse to check whether they were arrived.

campaign.story:
You're the new owner of a small campground along the river Ardèche. It all seems so easy! A small plot of land, a reception and a website is all you need to receive some income from tourists.
Satisfied you take a rest – but not for long, as your guests already leave for greener pastures! They like your competitor's campground more: the ‘Clash d’Ardèche’ has begun. 
Claim the best sites, bluff out your competitors, bribe the mayor and fulfill your secret assignment to win!
With this expansion pack, just bribe the mayor to be the one and only player with permission to receive camper-vans on your campground. Will you acquire this monopoly? The permit is given every season, so just take care to be the first in line!
MRSP: €10, now on Kickstarter: €6 (shipping included). Content: 7 Camper-vans + rules.

Just pledge your tier + €6 to receive one Camper-van expansion pack.
                      The above is a prototype, not the final version of game components. Dutch gameplay video here.
Clash d’Ardèche is a bluffing & strategic area control game for 1-4 players. In approximately one hour you start from scratch to end with a thriving campground.
Invest your money wisely: buy the best facilities, broadcast radio commercials and bribe the mayor at the right time to expand and flourish. The bluffing element in the game is the time when you set the price you charge your guests. What price is set by your opponents? And how will their guests react to your price?

Because every player has a secret assignment with different victory conditions, players follow different strategies and replayability is high.
Some upgrades for your campground
The two core game mechanics are the price-quality steps and the bribe cards. 
The price-quality steps determine to which campground guests want to go. Influence those guests by building starbuildings on your campground and by charging them higher or lower prices. Because you don't know the price set by your competitors, this is the time when you have to bluff your way to the desired outcome. Be careful not to chase away your own guests though!
The bribe cards are a combination of worker placement, card drafting and set collection-mechanics. Different combinations of cigars, jewellery and wine get you powerful favors from the friendly mayor.
In the expert version another mechanic is added: the gameboard becomes a strategic puzzle as your guests want to camp nearby your sanitary, swimming pool or restaurant. Luckily you can also let them use your neighbours' facilities :-).
Hostel and Water Park camping upgrades
Solo-game
In the solo-version of Clash d'Ardèche the friendly, but slightly corrupt mayor has gone megalomaniac. His nice country house in the outskirts of the small French village is no longer any good, he now demands the island as the vicinity for his mansion! Rules can be downloaded on our BGG-page.
Games are shipped from within the USA and the EU, so no extra taxes apply. Shipping can be very complicated, but we want to keep it simple: we'll use the Royal Dutch Mail for worldwide shipping, Amazon Fulfillment for the USA and DHL for the Netherlands and Belgium.

Shipping Costs:
USA, France, Germany, the Netherlands and Belgium: €5
Europe & Canada: €9
Worldwide: €17
  The rules and Print&Play files of the game are freely available on our BGG-page.   
The game comes with Dutch, French and English rules and cards.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Maybe you've noticed we launched this game before, in june this year. Despite positive reviews we didn't fund. Now we're back. 

Main difference with the former campaign is the participation of illustrator Shaz Yong and graphic designer Sebastián Koziner in this project. They totally transformed the looks of the game. We hope you like what they did with the artwork!
About 70% of the illustrations of the game is finished. 

This means the main risks of this project concern production and shipping. We keep these risks as low as possible, by only using well-known and trusted factories and shipping companies.

The time table after this campaign is as follows: 
November-December: finishing of graphic design 
January-February: production in factory 
March: shipping from China to USA & Europe 
April: shipping to your home addresses

We love this game as much as you do, so we'll give our 100% to get this working!

campaign.story:
Nothing To Declare is a fast, fun, easy to learn card game for the whole family. 
Each player takes on the role of a devious passenger, returning home from their travels hell-bent on smuggling some of the world’s most weird and wacky items illegally through customs. 
The stranger the item, the more points it’s worth. Think uranium, cow brains, stuffed armadillos dressed like cowboys – you know the usual stuff.   
But beware! Players have access to ‘passenger cards’. Each passenger card has a unique ability to sabotage and reveal the contents of their rival’s baggage. As well as attempting to keep their own baggage concealed, players must pay attention to where other high value items are hiding amongst their opponents’ bags. Be careful not to draw a rogue inspection card, which are hidden within the deck, as this will affect all players!
Already Unlocked:
2 new passengers
Deluxe edition with playmat addon
Upgraded cardstock
Upgraded artwork
Tweet the TSA to say thank you for inspiring this game
      37 unique pieces of artwork for the baggage items!
 Now 10 different passengers!
    You're returning home from your travels, your bags full of weird and wonderful (but mostly ridiculous) items to bring home to impress your friends. Now just don't get stopped by customs!
The game is made of two decks, passenger cards and baggage cards
Passengers   
Each passenger has a unique ability to help protect your baggage or expose the baggage of your opponent. 
You have to choose wisely which passenger to play in which round to maximise their effectiveness!
Baggage
Players begin with 3 baggage cards, the object of game is to get the highest scoring baggage through to the end of the game. All baggage items are based on real things people have tried to smuggle through customs!
yes, people really tried to take this stuff on a plane
As you pick-up more baggage, be sure to keep an eye out for what other players have in their bags!
Inspection
Inspection cards are part of the baggage deck. These cards have powerful actions that have an impact on everyone!

The beauty of making a board game is the more we raise the more we can add to the game. We've already unlocked those in green!
  I've always considered myself a gamer, I was grew up during the vicious console wars of the 90's. Luckily I survived, and since being introduced to the world of the modern board game I've become somewhat obsessed. 
Having built up a considerable collection, I couldn't help but be inspired to give back to the community that has given me so much joy. 
I want people to play more games. To achieve this I want to create games that appeal to a wide audience. That is why I created apauling games. We want to make games that are fun, engaging and contemporary. 
Nothing To Declare is our first game. We've been working on it for some time and we have the rest of the project planned out to ensure that we deliver the game in a timely fashion. 
  I've been working on Nothing To Declare for about a year, in that time the game has gone through many iterations and improvements.
This has been a passion project of ours and it's now at a stage where we want to share it with you. This is the point where we cannot go any further without your help.
To make Nothing To Declare the best it can be we need to raise the funds to have it professionally manufactured.    
We really need you to make this game all it can be. We've got some cool things planned throughout the campaign to get everyone involved and make sure everyone has their say on the final product.
The art is 90% done and everything is lined up with our manufacturing and fulfillment partners we just need the funds to get over that final hurdle. 
Because Nothing To Declare is a small box game we don't have to pay any large customs fees. This means we can offer worldwide friendly shipping and pass those savings on to you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If you're familiar with board game Kickstarters you'll understand that there are things that affect all board game Kickstarters. 

Mostly the biggest risks are around shipping and fulfillment. Things might get held up at customs, there might be delays in shipping, essentially we could be late. To mitigate this as much as possible I've built in a pretty large buffer to allow us to get the game to you in good time. 

Barring anything out of the ordinary (sharknado, alien invasion, shortage of trees) we should be good! 

Yes this is my first time doing this, but I have been planning this for months, have contacts with a lot of very experienced people who know what they're doing and have partnered with some of the best in field when it comes to manufacturing and fulfilment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi there!
It’s been a long time since I’ve been in touch, after Nothing To Declare I’ve been on quite a journey, which I won’t bore you with.
The TL;DR version is that my friends and I have set up a publishing company called Play For Keeps and our first game is now on Kickstarter.

Hello!
I hope you're doing well. I understand people are still receiving their games but I can confirm that all games have now been dispatched (unless you asked us to hold on to it for a little while). 
Translations
We now have the rules translated into French, German and Spanish. A huge thank you to the people that volunteered to do this work. It literally wouldn't have happened without you.

It's so exciting to know that people have been receiving their games! 
I've been reading all of your comments and posts online, once again I cannot thank you enough for your support. Without you this wouldn't have been possible.
2 player variant

It's that exciting time when people are starting to get their hands on the game, finally. 
It's been a long journey and I can't thank you enough for supporting me. I really hope you enjoy the game and have fun with it. 
There's still a few things to finish off before we're finished.

Apologies for the delay in sending out this update, I wanted to make sure I had something concrete to report.
I've spoken to our fulfilment partner GamesQuest, seems there was a bit of miscommunication but game entered their warehouse at the end of last week.
They've advised me that all games should be sent out by the end of this week!

Hi there
I've just got word that games should be hitting the port on Monday! Which is only a couple of days off the original estimate.

Hi there,
Just a quick update to say that the ship is currently heading past Egypt so things are looking good.
Also the addresses weren't actually locked down on 30 June (I moved house and didn't have internet), so I have now triggered the 48 hour reminder.

Well almost...
The games are scheduled to be picked up from China on Friday and, barring any delays, should arrive with the fulfilment company on 20 July.

Hi there,
I hope this update finds you well. Things are really rolling along nicely now. I'll just shut up and show you some pictures.

Well hello there, I hope you are well. 
I've returned from a holiday break with some news. Our manufacturer WinGo has provided me with the digital proofs (these are the print files that be used for production). 
I've reviewed these and made a few amendments, which they will incorporate. Once that's good everything should kick in to full swing.

campaign.story:
Sho-Riu, The Dragon King stands tall on a 90mm base
    Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress is a brand new, fully cooperative, dungeon crawl adventure board game, set in Feudal Japan, and is part of the Shadows of Brimstone™ game series!
    Players take on the role of courageous Heroes, fighting back a tide of evil creatures and demons that have invaded their world! Play as the stalwart Samurai Warrior, using your mastery of the Katana and your bushido code of honor to defeat your foes in combat, the nimble and deadly ninja Assassin, using stealth and speed as weapons, the Traveling Monk, a member of an ancient Yamabushi order devoted to fighting supernatural creatures wherever they may be found, and the powerful and mystic Sorceress, who wields Elemental Magik to crush her enemies.
    Set in Feudal Japan, the Heroes must brave the Forbidden Fortress; a feudal castle overrun with all manner of Demons, Ghosts, and Monsters inspired by Japanese myth and legend. The massive Oni, red beast-like ogres wielding giant clubs, stalk the halls, while deadly Tengu sword masters descend from the skies with their raven wings to attack the Heroes. Legions of Samurai Dishonored Dead rise from the grave, and writhing Acidic Tentacles burst from the floor to spit acid and feed on the Heroes with their razor sharp teeth.
But at the heart of the fortress lie the most terrifying and epic foes of all; the Harionago, a ghostly, demonic woman, held aloft by the twisting strands of her animated hair, which is also used to entangle and slash at the Heroes with its vicious barbs, and the towering Living Statue, possessed by Darkness to break away from its posts, wreaking havoc and smashing the castle it was once built to protect!
We've just added a Surprise Bonus to both Sumo and Shogun Pledges!
 Game Features
Includes 27 beautifully detailed, multi piece hard plastic, 32mm scale game miniatures for the Heroes and Enemies, each designed with dynamic poses and detail perfect for painting.
Immersive adventures and story driven gameplay, using the expansive and popular Shadows of Brimstone™ Game Engine.
Fully Cooperative, with all of the players working together against the game itself
Dynamically generated adventures, 12 different Missions, and 4 unique Heroes with many options for customization, the game is designed for massive replayability.
Easy to learn with simple but fun gameplay and rewarding thematic story moments as you progress your Heroes.
Built-in Campaign system for keeping your Hero characters from game to game, finding new items on your adventures and gaining new skills and abilities as you go up in level.
Heroes can visit a Feudal Japanese Village between mission to re-stock and re-supply before the next adventure, having a mini-adventure in town.
Double-sided Map Tiles include a Forbidden Fortress of Feudal Japan on one side and the Belly of the Beast OtherWorld on the back side for the Heroes to explore; stepping through a shimmering portal and continuing their adventures in an alien world inside of a massive living creature.
Over 250 game cards, a full set of beautifully illustrated, double-sided Map Tiles, a host of dice and counters, and all of the large Hero and Enemy record sheets needed to play
Includes a CD Soundtrack of original Music, created to set the mood while playing.
Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress can be played on its own as a stand-alone game, or it can be used in combination with any and all of the other Shadows of Brimstone products already available! It is fully compatible, in every way! For new players, Forbidden Fortress will make a great introduction to the world of Shadows of Brimstone, and for veteran players, it adds a ton of new content, including two brand new Worlds to explore - the Japanese castles and temples of the Forbidden Fortress and a living world inside a massive creature in the Belly of the Beast. It also includes a brand new set of Heroes and Enemies to add to your games. With the option of starting your Heroes in Feudal Japan or the Old West, or having a mixed party of Heroes, drawn from both worlds, the possibilities are endless!
The Belly of the Beast OtherWorld
Forbidden Fortress also adds a brand new OtherWorld on the back side of the Map Tiles… The Belly of the Beast! Backers from the original Brimstone Kickstarter may recognize this as an OtherWorld Stretch Goal that was not unlocked during the original campaign. When we started formalizing what would be in Forbidden Fortress, the idea of adding the Belly of the Beast as the OtherWorld on the back side of the tiles was a perfect fit! What could be more in keeping with the Japanese theme than allowing the Heroes to find their way through a portal that leads inside of an unspeakably massive creature; battling all sorts of living organs and parasites, and fighting off the Flesh Mites, Acid Blobs, and Parasitic Tentacles that inhabit this ‘living’ world.
What You Get in the Core Set Box
The Core Set for Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress includes all of the following:
(Note that the final version of contents may vary from those shown here).
The Temple of Shadows Deluxe Expansion
The Temple of Shadows was once the home of an ancient and powerful order of Yamabushi monks, dedicated to battling supernatural creatures throughout the land. It was foretold that one day the Great Dragon King, Sho-Riu would return to destroy the Earth, and only they could stop him. When the meteor came from the heavens and devastated the mountain, the Dragon King came with it. For generations the monks had been training for this moment, and as Sho-Riu descended on the temple, they gathered their strength and prepared to fulfill their destiny.
But their victory was not to be. Reigning down death and destruction, the Dragon King broke through the monk’s defenses and utterly destroyed the order, devouring their souls and bringing Darkness and shadow into the sacred temple. Those few that survived were scattered and leaderless, but they would not sit idle. Traveling the roads and countryside, the last of the monks dedicated their lives to finding new Heroes that could one day fulfill the prophecy and reclaim… the Temple of Shadows!
Building on the themes from the Forbidden Fortress Core Set, the Temple of Shadows Deluxe Expansion adds a ton of new content for the Feudal Japan setting and the Belly of the Beast OtherWorld. This boxed set includes:
4 New Hero Classes
Enforcer – An outlaw and a gangster, the Enforcer is an anti-Hero renegade who favors brute strength and intimidation over elegant fighting weapons and technique. His tattooed body is hardened and scarred from a lifetime of brutal brawling.
Geisha – Beautiful but deadly, the Geisha is a cunning and stealthful fighter. She employs deception and trickery to evade and confuse enemies, while slashing with her hidden blade from behind. Her comforting presence can heal the Heroes, both body and soul, to keep them in the fight.
Soldier – The Soldier is a veteran of warfare who has seen many battles and is an expert marksman with his Rifle. Though he does not have the style or family heritage of the Samurai, he is a hardened foot soldier that has access to a variety of different weapons and training.
Kitsune – A guardian spirit, the Kitsune has come forward to defend this world against the demons and creatures that would threaten to destroy it. Taking on a human-fox form, the Kitsune uses supernatural tricks and auras to protect the Heroes, while darting between enemies to deliver killing blows with her deadly blades.
4 New Enemy Types
Chochinobake – These demon-possessed, animated lanterns swarm the Heroes, relentlessly biting and burning them with terrifying speed.
Takobake Warriors – Once a noble clan, the Takobake have embraced the power of the Dark Stone. Using its energy to grow in strength, they have become mutated into tentacled monstrosities, twisted and evil.
Skin Crawlers – These large, parasitic creatures burrow through the flesh and muscle walls in the Belly of the Beast, rising up from the pools of sticky mucus to assault any Heroes foolish enough to enter into their feeding grounds.
The Fallen Shogun – This dreadful leader of the Takobake clan was one of the first to discover the magical properties of the Dark Stone. Weaving it into his armor, and forging it into weapons, he has gone mad with power, mutating into a giant among men! Declaring himself Shogun, he now sweeps across the land with his legions of mutated soldiers, conquering any who would stand in his way.
New Material for the Forbidden Fortress and Belly of the Beast
This expansion also features 4 new double-sided Map Tiles with new rooms for the Forbidden Fortress on one side and the Belly of the Beast on the other, 6 New Missions for the Temple of Shadows, loads of new cards and counters, and much more!
.
What You Get in the Temple of Shadows Deluxe Expansion Box
The Temple of Shadows Deluxe Expansion includes all of the following:
(Note that the final version of contents may vary from those shown here). Box Cover Art is Stand-in.
Kickstarter Exclusives
There are two Kickstarter Exclusive Hero Classes created for this campaign.
As part of the Sumo Pledge Level, a backer will get the KS Exclusive Sumo Hero Class.
Sumo – A massive and imposing figure, the Sumo has trained all his life for unarmed battle in the wrestling ring. But when Demons and Monsters sweep across the land, he answers the call, stepping out of the ring and onto the battlefield.
Mounted on a 40mm base, the Sumo is the first ever large size Hero. He uses his weight and strength to mercilessly crush his foes, pushing enemies around the board and body slamming them with unbridled fury.
As part of the Shogun Pledge Level, a backer will also get the KS Exclusive Samurai Daimyo Hero Class, which also includes 3 Armored Ashigaru Foot Soldiers for him to command!
Samurai Daimyo – A clan leader and military general, the Samurai Daimyo uses strategy and tactics to outwit and outmaneuver his opponents. As a powerful commander and trained Samurai warrior, he leads his armies into combat, for honor and glory!
The Samurai Daimyo starts each adventure with up to 3 Armored Ashigaru Foot Soldier Allies to command. In addition to being a skilled fighter, the Daimyo is also a natural leader, and many of his skills and abilities focus on giving bonuses to the rest of the Heroes and his Foot Soldiers
Stretch Goals
There are 2 types of Stretch Goals that can be unlocked during the course of this Kickstarter campaign: Sumo Level Stretch Goals (marked in Light Tan) and Shogun Level Stretch Goals (marked in Purple).
Sumo Level Pledges will receive only the Light Tan Sumo Level Stretch Goals, while Shogun Level Pledges will receive both the Light Tan Sumo Level Stretch Goals as well as all of the Purple Shogun Level Stretch Goals. 
How To Purchase Add-Ons
To purchase items from the Add-Ons Menu below, simply click the “Manage Your Pledge” button at the top of this page and increase your pledge amount to include the additional cost of the items that you’d like to get. You don’t have to specify what you want yet, that will happen in the Pledge Manager after the Forbidden Fortress KS Campaign has finished.
How Does the Game Play?
Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress is a fully-cooperative, Dungeon Crawl adventure game! That means that all of the players form a Hero team (or you can play solo) and are working together against the game itself, entering the torch-lit castle gates and exploring dark courtyards and mysterious chambers within a fortress that has been overrun with creatures and demons!  The team can take on different missions from the Adventure Book, each with unique set up and victory conditions. You may be searching for a sacred artifact, stolen from the nearby temple by demons and carried off to the dark fortress, or you might be tasked with sealing off portals that unspeakable creatures are pouring out of!
1-4 Players (or up to 6 Players if combined with the Temple of Shadows Expansion) create their Heroes by selecting a Hero Class to play, such as the Samurai Warrior or Sorceress. That Hero Class defines your basic character stats - how much Health and Sanity you have, how good you are at hitting enemies with your Katana, how good you are at solving puzzles or dodging fiendish traps, etc. It also defines your basic starting Gear - do you start with a sword, a staff, shuriken? Also, any abilities that all characters of your Hero Class share (a Samurai’s "Code of Honor" for example). Each Hero also starts with a Random Personal Item that gives them a bit more ‘character’, and they get to choose one of three Starting Upgrades unique to their Hero Class. This gives players a chance to start guiding their Hero’s development right from the outset!
Once your team is ready to go, the players roll (or decide) what Mission they have taken on and the game begins! Each Hero is represented by a figure on the game board and all of the figures are placed on the Fortress Entrance Map Tile to start the game. All of the Card Decks are shuffled, each Hero gets 1 Grit Token, and the Depth Track is setup with the Hero Party’s marker on the entrance and the Darkness marker deep in the fortress (at the opposite end of the track).
At the start of each turn, the Hero with the Lantern rolls 2 dice to Hold Back the Darkness! This roll needs to be equal to or greater than the number listed on the current stage of the Depth Track. If the roll is passed, the Heroes carry on without delay. If the roll is failed, the Darkness moves one step up the track toward escaping the fortress! But beware, if the Darkness marker ever reaches the entrance space on the Depth Track, it has escaped, and the mission is failed. As an added element of danger, if the Hold Back the Darkness roll is ever doubles (1-1, 3-3, etc), this instead triggers a random event from the Depth Event Chart equal to that number!
Heroes now take their turn in order of Initiative, with the highest going first. During a Hero’s Activation, they roll a die and may move up to the amount rolled. If a 1 is rolled, the Hero also recovers an extra Grit Token. Grit Tokens are used for a number of things in game. A Grit Token may be discarded to Re-roll any number of your dice just rolled (though no die may be Re-rolled more than once), or a Grit Token may be discarded to move an extra die roll worth of spaces during your Movement. A Grit Token may also be used to activate certain powerful character abilities.
After moving, the Hero may attack if there are any enemies on the board, or if they have ended their move in a space adjacent to a doorway (an open exit from the map tile you are on), you may look down the hall and draw a random Map Card to place the next Map Tile, connecting it to the doorway you are looking through. Each time a new Map Tile is placed, you must also move the Hero Party’s marker one step forward on the Depth Track, as the Hero Team delves deeper into the fortress. This is important because as the Heroes go deeper underground, it becomes harder and harder to Hold Back the Darkness (the number required to roll gets higher, the deeper the Hero Party has gone).
Newly placed Map Tiles are always either a Room or a Passage. Passage Tiles have open doorways on all ends and can often split the path in front of the Heroes. They do not, however, contain Encounters for the Heroes to deal with. Room Tiles, on the other hand, always come into play with an Exploration Token on them. As long as there is an unrevealed Exploration Token on a Map Tile, Heroes may not look through Doorways on that Map Tile (you can’t explore further than that room with the unrevealed token). At the end of a full Hero Turn (after all Heroes have been Activated), if there are one or more Heroes in a Room with an Exploration Token, that token is revealed!
While exploring, Heroes can find large, swirling portals that the Enemies are coming through to attack, and they can step through those gateways into a crazy alien World, continuing their adventures on the other side! All of the Map Tiles are double-sided, with the Fortress on one side and an alien OtherWorld on the back side. In Shadows of Brimstone:  Forbidden Fortress, the alien World included is the Belly of the Beast! Stepping through the portal, the Heroes find themselves inside an unfathomably large creature, exploring the living passages and inner chambers of its massive body, dripping with goo and overrun with parasites and living defenses.
Once the Heroes have reached their objective for the mission being played, they will often have one final Epic battle with an Enemy boss to complete the Adventure!
Between Adventures, the Heroes can travel back to a nearby Japanese Village to re-stock and re-supply, having a mini-Adventure in Town before setting out on the next Mission.
Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress has a built in campaign system allowing the players to keep their Heroes from game to game, finding cool new Gear and Artifacts that they can use in their continuing Adventures, while gaining experience and going up in level to unlock new skills chosen from their Class-Specific Skill Tree.
Game Miniatures
The Miniatures included in Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress and the Temple of Shadows Expansion are multi-part HIPS hard plastic. They come on frames and do require some assembly. We have taken great care to make the assembly in as few pieces per model as possible, while still getting a high level of detail and fantastic, dynamic poses. This also brings an aspect of Hobby to the game as many players find it fun to customize and paint their figures.
Shipping
This project is US, EU, Canada, UK, and Australia Friendly Shipping!
Our intent is to ship all Pledge Rewards and Stretch Goals for this KS project as a single shipping Wave.
However, all extra Add-On items (added individually beyond your Pledge Level/Stretch Goals) will be shipped separately from the main Pledge Rewards/Stretch Goals, and will  likely ship AFTER the main Pledge Rewards/Stretch Goals.
Extra Add-on items are US, EU, UK, Canada, and Australia Friendly. They will be packed and delivered to our distribution centers in the EU, UK, Canada, and Australia (at our expense) and then shipped to individual Backer addresses from within the EU, UK, Canada, and Australia for Backers in those regions.
Shipping and handling charges are not included in the pledge levels. We will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter ends, based on the actual costs to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. We will ship your rewards (at our cost) to our distribution centers in the US (in Washington State), Australia, UK, Canada, and the EU. Backers will then be responsible for shipping charges from the most appropriate distribution center to your address.

What is Shadows of Brimstone?
Shadows of Brimstone™ is a fully cooperative, dungeon crawl, adventure game, set in the Old West and mashed up with unspeakable horror. First appearing as a wildly successful Kickstarter campaign in 2013, Shadows of Brimstone™ was released to retail in late 2014 and has been going strong ever since.
The game supports 1-6 players, has a standard game time of 2-3 hours, and includes a campaign system for keeping your Hero characters from game to game, finding new items on your adventures and gaining new skills and abilities as you go up in level. You can also visit an Old West Frontier Town between adventures to re-stock and re-supply before setting out on your next mission, and during the game, you can find the swirling portals that the terrifying enemies are coming from, and you can step through those gateways to continue your adventures on the other side, in another dimension or alien world. The map tiles are all double-sided, with the Old West Mines on one side and an alien environment on the other side.
One of the main features of Shadows of Brimstone™ is that all of the players work together against the game itself, and that everything is card-based and dynamically generated as you play (the encounters, enemies, board layout, etc.), meaning that the game never plays the same way twice.
Flying Frog Productions
Flying Frog Productions, LLC is a premier traditional game company that focuses on fun, theme-heavy, story driven board games. Their first game, Last Night on Earth™, made a big splash when it launched in 2007, and since then they have released many more games such as A Touch of Evil™, Fortune and Glory™, and Shadows of Brimstone™, as well as dozens of expansions to provide continued support for all of their game lines. You can find more information about Flying Frog Productions at www.flyingfrog.net, flyingfrogwiki.com, as well as their pages on Facebook, Twitter, and www.BoardGameGeek.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As an established game company, Flying Frog Productions has been making high quality, thematic, fun games for nearly ten years! We launched our first Kickstarter Campaign in October of 2013 for the original Shadows of Brimstone, and have been through the process, working out the pipeline and navigating the hurdles. That project was enormous, with many moving parts, and logistical challenges. We have learned many lessons from that experience that will go into making this new Kickstarter project even better! The success of the first Kickstarter campaign allowed us to hire additional staff in our studio and find new manufacturing contacts who can produce higher quality miniatures and components.

Miniatures – We have been producing HIPS hard plastic, multi-part figures for over 3 years now, working with several factories to refine the pipeline and process. The results are figures that keep getting better and better detail and quality, both in the tooling of the molds and the sculpting of the figures. The miniatures in Forbidden Fortress are some of our absolute best to date, and we are very excited for backers to see the level of detail on these figures.

Delivery Timeline – "Is March 2018 a realistic Delivery timeframe for this project?"
Yes. By going through the (admittedly long) process of the first Shadows of Brimstone KS, we developed the pipeline and the tools needed to complete a project like this. Most of the rules and systems for the game are already in place, and this project is all about adding a lot of fun new content that builds on the established Game Engine.

Several factors contribute to giving this project a faster delivery time than the original Shadows of Brimstone KS:
- The Pledge Levels are streamlined to give only 2 variations on Rewards to be delivered, Sumo Level and Shogun Level boxes.
- Pledge Rewards will be packed and shipped from China directly to our distribution facilities around the world in the US, Australia, Canada, UK, and EU.
- Extra Add-ons added beyond the Pledge Rewards and Stretch Goals will be packed separately on a per backer basis. Extra Add-Ons will be shipped separately using EU, US, Canada, UK, and Australia Friendly shipping to allow backers to add extra items without slowing down the main project delivery timeline.
- The project has been scoped to better fit the production window and estimated delivery of March 2018.

In some cases, we couldn’t even get a straight answer of where the shipments were in the process, having been picked up from the factory, but seemingly not able to be loaded onto their scheduled vessels. Due to the hectic craziness in Ocean Shipping with Chinese New Year and a shortage of containers and Vessels from the ongoing Covid Pandemic, it has been challenging. When businesses in China shut down for Chinese New Year, even communication grinds to a halt. Right now, Ocean Freight Shipping across the world is in chaos.

campaign.story:
http://ludicreations.com/newsletter/
Imagine for a second that you are selling your latest board game at Essen. You recruited volunteers, set up demo tables, and built up your booth. Your games are selling like cardboard hotcakes. All is well until you turn around, and your shiny new cash box is gone...
This is Steal This Game, based on a true story.
On Saturday, 15 October 2016, around 4 pm, our cashier realized that in the 10 seconds it took to look in our warehouse for a game, our cash box was gone.
For a small indie board game publisher, this represents a significant loss. Besides the financial hit, this has also affected us on an emotional level.
Games are fun. Gamers are fun. They are also some of the most welcoming, generous, and trusting people around. For this to happen during the greatest celebration of cardboard & wood in all of boardgamedom is a devastating blow.
According to what venue security told us when we submitted the police report, this is likely the work of professionals. Fellow friendly publishers have indicated that they noticed similar attempts or approaches by individuals that did not seem to know much about the hobby. We hope and assume that this was not done by any gamer.
THE GAME
The card front (draft)
This asymmetric nanogame, playable by two players in five minutes or less, fits on a postcard (with two dice supplied by the players). One player takes on the role of a boardgame publisher at a big convention.
The other player is a thief, intent on robbing the publisher's booth — rolling dice, lying, guessing, and shuffling cards.
The card back (draft)
The exhibitor tries to keep the cash hidden in one of the four cash boxes. The thief secretly rolls a pair of dice and then tries to make increasingly risky moves in order to gain more information about the location of the cash.
If the exhibitor catches the thief while attempting this, the thief makes one last attempt to steal. If that fails, then the exhibitor wins.
UPDATE
New design (work in progress):
RULES
For more details on the components and rules of Steal This Game, download the rule book here (right click and Save as…). Please download this file, as PDFs viewed in-browser may not display properly. This file is the low-resolution version of the final rules document.
VIDEOS

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vFZ57uzcevI

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=clNRbiTxmCU
DEVELOPMENT
Steal This Game was designed, developed, prototyped, and playtested within one night, the night of the robbery. And yeah, we actually had fun with it. Here's a taste of what happened:
PLAY

  We are offering some of our games, at or below the SPIEL'16 price. Every little bit helps, and we are happy for any support that you are able to provide.
We have also been able to add some bundles of games. Variations or substitutions are not possible due to stock levels, weights of games and our desire to give you as much value as possible.
To find out more about the above rewards, please visit the LudiCreations website.
We will ship all existing games from our warehouse in Essen, Germany. The postcards may be sent from Germany, Hungary or Finland. EU backers do not have to worry about customs or VAT.
Shipments to backers outside of the EU and the USA will have the base game cost declared as the value of the package (the shipping cost will not be included in the declaration). The postcards are not subject to taxes.
The postcard will be sent through regular mail. Tracking is not offered through this campaign. If tracking is important to you, please contact us via the KS messaging system before the campaign is over.
Please note that we can not take any responsibility for any lost or damaged copies to Brazil, Hungary, Russia, or South Africa.
There is a large number of incredibly talented and even more generous people that we would like to thank.
First among them is David Turczi, who never even said "of course" when asked to design this game. He was too busy putting mechanisms together. A credit to any publisher that has the fortune to work with him.
More to come over the next few days.

"How long does it take to deliver a simple postcard?!??", one would be entirely within their rights to ask.
The honest answer is "WTFGRGRRRHHHWAAAH!!!!!", according to at least one member of the development team.

Greetings, LudiCrats!
Fulfillment - part III
We hope that this update finds you in good spirits, surrounded by your fellow board game geeks, enjoying a board game or two. We know that some of you (most?) may already be enjoying the games we sent out as thanks for your generous contribution after that... incident at Spiel.

Greetings, LudiCrats!
Fulfillment - part I
As you read in backer update #5, Steal This Game is sent separately from all other pledge material - so for those of who have pledged for other games, they are on their way (or have arrived). We first shipped all the individual small-box games, followed by the pledges for multiple games and for the big box games. This was completed right around the end of the year. Due to a shipping error we made, 60 individual copies of They Who Were 8 were sent after that.

Greetings!
Let's start with fulfillment, which is far more important right now. After you have read through this important information, you will see some cool images from our production test.
Fulfillment

Greetings!
So, time for a little update on what we have been doing to make Steal This Game a reality.

If the words "board games", "help sick children" and "matching gift" are enough for you, you can stop reading right here, and head over to this page and donate with us:
http://www.extra-life.org/participant/ludicreations

Greetings, LudiCrats!

Hello :) Welcome to my Fourth Kickstarter known as "Meanders": giant modular boards strewn with wandering paths that fit together with other similar-themed Meander. This Kickstarter is aimed at that special need for terrain between quests. A place for all of the stuff that happens in the beloved - but oft overlooked - mid-way point: shortly after departure from the tavern/spaceport/craft and just before the arrival at the dragon-filled mountain range or Alien Queens acid filled biomass cavern.
What happens between setting off and finally arriving is perhaps the most important aspect of RPG to capture the imagination, for the Journey from Here to There represents endless possibility for stories to evolve, a mystical place for stumbling upon new side-quests, sudden action, the excitement of exploration and the threat of random encounters where anything can happen and often does.
Yet while they are particularly intended for areas after leaving the tavern/spaceship and before reaching the location of major quests - allowing players to wander the wilderness or planetary landscape - they also serve up a number of classic RPG tropes for situating major quests such as: a Desert Shipwreck or Temple Ruins, Woodland Altar or Forest Pond, Alpine Cemetery or Jungle Swingbridge. Each board has a mixture of narrow and wide paths with multiple clearings for hiding treasure chests, trapdoors, entrances to your dungeons or your custom secrets and strategic terrain design for setting up ambushes, wandering monster or NPC encounters and even labyrinths. Need an endless desert? Enchanted forest that won't let them leave? Lost in the snow? Meanders can take care of it for you. 
Meanders provide instant and massive adventure vistas for characters to wander through a variety of classic (and not-so-classic) tropes: from sprawling forest and steaming jungle, miles of snow or near-endless desert - and how big you make the playground is up to you. Simply join another board or boards of the same or different theme to your Meander and it will line up all of the paths, doubling, trebling or quadrupling the size of the Meander. Create a gigantic sprawling landscape just waiting to be populated with NPC's, monsters, treasure and Meanders provides enough caverns, clearings and paths to lead almost anywhere... 
While the majority of my completed pieces are Fantasy based - I am creating terrain for the Sci-fi RPGer's with plans for a gigantic Space Hulk, Deep Space, Planet Surfaces and Geiger-esque terrain suitable for Tyranids, Alien, Space Marines, Chthulu, and whatever else we can think of.
Meanders are beautifully and carefully illustrated with shadows, lighting, realism and depth: take a look at these artwork samples.
Forest Themed Meanders
  Jungle Themed Meanders
  Snow Themed Meanders
  Desert Themed Meanders
      Gemstone Caverns Meanders
  Alien Terrain
  Chthulian Dimensions
  1 of 4 Underdark Designs Unlocked @ 3k
Each Meander measures 27 x 18" each and is professionally printed on 60pt chipboard covered with matt finish paper on one side and black backing on the other with a dry/wet erasable finish. These are thick, high-quality durable dry/wet erase boards that unfold into a six-fold board or up into a 9" square observable in the campaign video. This is a similar tried and tested board used for one of my previous Kickstarters for Urban Rooftops (please see below). You can also select various grid or no grid options and up to 4 individual terrain boards per themed-set (with some derivations available via stretch goals).
Meanders are also designed with identical entrances/exits on each board - plus overlapping foliage - that helps blend the boards together when paired so you can easily enlarge the size of the Meander from a short walk (1-2 boards) to a days ride (4 boards) to an epic sojourn through snow, desert, forest and jungle. (6+ boards) without that harsh clash of contrasts or mis-matching trees. Each board in its own series fits with the others.
Meanders can theoretically be joined to different terrains in the same series because the paths all occupy identical points: the join is not as neat, but it can be done.
ADDITIONAL OPTIONS
Please note: there will be a free option to have Meanders electronically joined to each other for your convenience at the end of the campaign. My computer processing will only allow me to do this with a maximum of four Meanders at a go but I can do it in separate blocks of 2-4 if you choose. I will of course adjust the grid so there is no overlap.  
Please also note: For an extra $2 per Meander I offer a service to join and blend terrains into one another more gradually so that you can place Snow by Forest without the overly harsh contrast and obvious join for instance. This is for those of you who enjoy the art but don't necessarily need modular terrain and are quite happy to have the 'four seasons' or don't need to change the terrain around. I.e. if you wanted your Sampler pack joined and you chose four different terrains this would be a good option to go with to have them blend into one another as one giant map and only cost you $16 in total. $8 for the sampler, $8 for the blend.
For some Boards, i.e. the Alien or Planetscapes there is an open colour choice so that you can get the planet surface colour you need to suit your games. 
Advantages of using Meanders over 8x8", 10x10" tiles are many:
Instant Terrain: No more time spent setting up smaller terrain squares: Meanders are huge 27x18" modular boards designed to flow on to and fit with one another. Why move ten tile squares when you can move one board?
Modifiable Size: Meanders can be folded in such a way to provide 18x9", 18x18", or the full 27x18" terrain template. (please see campaign video.)
Variation: By mix and matching Meanders you can achieve a range of different terrain arrangements within a single theme simply by moving the boards around one another OR pair them with other terrains to make an entire world.
Tough: Meanders are professionally printed on six-fold boads with a tough wet/dry erase, scuff/oil/liquid resistant coating.
Portable: Meanders fold down into a compact 9" for light-weight portability.
Flexibility: Using 1" squares, Meanders fit the scale of existing 1" RPG tiles and boards.
Grid Options: Choose No Grid, 1" Grid, Hex Grid or Cross-Hair.
100% Completed Art: The art for 16 different Meanders, 4 each in Forest, Snow, Desert and Jungle terrain are fully completed. 
Digital/Printed or Both: Get the digital designs, printed boards, or both.
Improvisation: Effortlessly add a huge Forest, Jungle or Desert to your game for your adventurers to explore, set up camp, be ambushed, for side and escort quests, or stretch out the campaign.
Element of Surprise: Sit your castle, cave, town, lake or other destination tiles/set-up on the black reverse of a folded board or at the edge of a path of a Meander and let your adventurers work their way through the traps, encounters and adventure towards it.
Join and Blend Options: You can have your Meanders joined to one another for absolutely free: with up to 4 Meanders joined into one map AND you can pay a few extra dollars to have your Meanders joined and neatly custom blended into one another to create a nice seamless flow between terrains for just $2 per Meander.
Inexpensive: Get (Edit: 36+) giant 27x18" Meanders for $25 AUD. No other kickstarter has ever offered this much quality terrain for such an amazing price.
Want to break down what I'm offering for just $25?
4 Forest Meanders
4 Snow Meanders
4 Desert Meanders
4 Jungle Meanders
6 Fantasy City / Castle & Frost Castle Meanders
4 Alien Terrain Meanders
2 Autumn Meanders
2 Nocturnal Meanders
2 Village and Fields Meanders
2 Elven Treetop City Meanders
2 Gemstone Cavern Meanders
& all those digital goodies are yours if the campaign funds. Go beyond funding and it gets even crazier. And since we did, it has.
Besides the 36 Core Meanders - Extra themed Meanders to choose from can be unlocked and added to your $25+ pledge just through the project funding: with the potential for even more additional designs to be added through achieving the following Stretch Goals.
 ... And should there be time - whatever else you and I can come up with.
 This is my Fourth Kickstarter on the back of three previously successfully           funded campaigns bringing creative innovations to life for RPG.
Thank you very much for your support and encouragement - I look forward to bringing these to a table-top near you - and as always please let me know if you have any questions about the campaign.
Kind Regards,
Kris McDermott

Risks and challenges
There are, as with any project, minor risks that are a staple of anyone attempting to create a product in third-party hands and deliver it on time - however, I create similar products like this (tiles/tokens) on a regular basis and have years of experience in the manufacturing and shipping sides of my small business. A quick check into my previous Kickstarter with Deluxe Reversible Rooftop Tiles or Soloman Temple Squares for RPG will indicate rapid delivery and full backer satisfaction with my products as well as full communication the entire campaign through. I work extremely hard to make sure my backers are happy with the products I make and to ensure everyone gets their rewards on or or before time. 

If there are any difficulties backers will immediately be notified and all possible steps taken to remedy them - but it is my experience that my production, manufacture and shipping is a stream-lined operation and backers can expect their rewards on time if not before time. 

Please let me know if you have any questions, concerns about the product or my campaign - I am always here to offer rapid response. Thank you,

Kind Regards, 
Kris McDermott

PLEASE NOTE: Each pledge level includes all previous pledge levels.

The optional Add-On sets (Windmill, ruins, dungeons, etc.) shown below must be added to your top level pledge, these are OPTIONAL sets and not included in any pledge level.
We do not use an after-campaign pledge manager. All pledges must be in by the end of the campaign.
DRAGONLOCK™ (patent pending) is an all-new interlocking terrain system that allows you to create fully modular, multi-level 28mm scale village terrain for your RPG or wargame on your home 3D printer. Each set is delivered in a downloadable .stl format via our online distribution partner DriveThruRPG.com, and once you have the set, you can print as many pieces as you like and never run out or need to purchase more. This new terrain system is the culmination of eleven years of gaming terrain design experience.
By supporting us through Kickstarter, you get bonus models that won't be available later, and access to free stretch rewards. We have been in the 'print-and-play' terrain business for over eleven years, and have successfully delivered seven previous Kickstarter projects, so you can pledge with confidence that we will deliver a high-quality product on time. 
FREE STRETCH REWARDS that will increase the size of the terrain offerings will be available to anyone pledging at the $45 level or higher. Spread the word about this project to your friends and post about it on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc., and GET FREE BONUS MODELS as the pledges rise!
A standard wall piece costs around $0.25 in plastic to print yourself, far cheaper than factory-made terrain! All of the models shown were printed at 100-150 micron resolution, a common standard on most economical 3D printers. A really nice starter printer that can print these files starts around $390 (see our F.A.Q. for more info on printers, printing costs, filaments, and more.)
Even if you don't currently own a 3D printer, it benefits you to support this campaign now. You can get all of the free stretch rewards, exclusive content in some sets not available later, and have a digital library of village terrain ready to go when you do purchase a printer.
All miniatures shown in our video and promotional shots are by Reaper Miniatures (www.reapermini.com) 
All models were printed on Printrbot Play & Simple 3D printers (www.printrbot.com)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fat Dragon Games is a small company, and we need to be careful what subjects we choose to proceed with for production. One or two poorly selling sets could hurt our company severely. By putting potential projects up on Kickstarter, we can be sure if there is demand for that subject before devoting our resources to it. We also get to connect directly with our customers, rewarding those who are early supporters for a set with cool stuff like exclusive pieces not available to customers who purchase the set later on, and free stretch rewards. We have been in the print-and-play terrain business for over eleven years, having released over one hundred and sixty terrain sets, and have had seven previous Kickstarter campaigns successfully funded and delivered, so supporters of this project can feel completely confident in our ability to deliver a high-quality product as promised.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Meeple Source is back with another great Character Meeple Kickstarter project!
It's been over 2 years since our first groundbreaking Kickstarter project that brought you 150 new Character Meeples, most of which were chosen by you, the backers! We have had tons of new ideas, and many of you have too, from the many requests that we've received. 
The goal of this Kickstarter project is to create quite a few brand new deluxe Character Meeples, some for use in particular games (Codenames, Colt Express, Near and Far, Stone Age, Imperial Settlers, Aquasphere, Champions of Midgard, Forbidden Island, Forbidden Desert, Targi, and more), and others for use in any game you love - simply because they are awesome!
We are proud to offer flat rate shipping for all backers. This means you can add-on your favorite sets (and individuals) without affecting your shipping amount - no limit!
               A mock-up of the Codenames meeples in action!
  Perfect for Champions of Midgard!
    All pledge levels can also be an add-on! That means that if you want more than one set, simply choose your main pledge level and add the amount of the additional set(s). It's that easy!
  We don't want anything to stand between you and some really fantastic Character Meeples. That is why we offer all of our Kickstarter backers an unconditional money-back guarantee (within 30 days of receiving your meeples). Your only responsibility would be the return shipping, but that is fairly inexpensive, as the pieces are small and light. We are that confident that you’ll love ‘em!
All orders are quality-controlled, packaged, and shipped with care from the Meeple Source lair in Orlando, FL. We do not use any outside fulfillment centers, here in the US or internationally. 
    Chris and Cynthia Landon are the siblings that own and operate Meeple Source. Andrea is the fantastic artist behind all of these new Character Meeples, and the overwhelming majority of our Character Meeples and upgraded resource bits to date. Karen and Erika are an incredibly important part of our quality control, packaging, and shipping team. 
Located in Orlando, FL, we are a small family business that takes great pride in superb product quality and excellent customer service!
  We have already created an enormous number of cool game pieces and accessories, so feel free to browse some of that past work on MeepleSource.com.
Imperial Settlers
  Orléans
         Puerto Rico

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Meeple Source has been making detailed, full-color Character Meeples for five years now. We are proud to say that we have a reputation for high quality pieces and great customer service.

Even with the success of our 7 completed Kickstarter projects to date, we are still a very small, family-run company that takes great pride in taking care of our customers and their orders personally. As a result, in combination with the enormous number of custom product combinations that we allow in our Kickstarter projects, shipping takes a good deal of time. To help with this, we have created some handy packages in this project, including themed sets and mixed packs of unique characters, that are designed to speed up fulfillment.

If you are one of our many repeat Kickstarter backers, you may know that a couple of our projects experienced minor delays, and that we were always straight-forward with regard to that. A distinct possibility for delay lies in the painting of the meeples. Although every individual meeple is hand-sorted for quality control, by us personally, there are times that errors in screen printing require that we re-make the entire batch of pieces for that particular Character Meeple. If this occurs, it will take a minimum of 8-10 weeks to replace them, which could delay shipping. For example, if this were to occur only a month before shipping would otherwise commence, some pledges would deliver after the estimated delivery date. Although we believe that we have allotted plenty of time for situations such as this, it should be noted that project delays are still a possibility. 

More than anything, we are committed to quality. Our past customers know that this is true, and our Kickstarter backers know that we offer a money-back guarantee on all pledges. So don't worry, we've got this!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
It's been a month since our last update, so we wanted to let you know where we are at with everything. Currently we have shipped the pledges for 87% of our backers. More will ship tonight, this weekend, and next week. So, it's going quite well! :-)
Everything for Scythe
The 19-piece set of encounter and expansion tokens was the last of the Scythe pieces that we were waiting on. If your pledge only consisted of Scythe stuff, your order was shipped about two weeks ago. You probably have it already, but if not, you should soon!

Although a day late, we want to wish every one of you a Happy New Year! We are excited to see what 2017 brings...
The Status of Things
By New Years Eve, we had shipped every Kickstarter order that was complete, based on the meeples that we have finished. This was just over 30% of the 2,629 backers - which is great! Some of the main sets that are completely ready at this point are Colt Express,  Near and Far, Codenames, Targi, Greek Mythology meeples, and Scythe Action Tokens (but not the worker meeples or expansion tokens).

Some rewards will ship before Christmas!
We are happy to say that while we don't have photos yet, the last of the Colt Express pieces are on the way to us, with Near and Far shortly behind them. So, we do expect to be able to ship Codenames and Colt Express rewards before Christmas, and possibly Near and Far as well! Unfortunately though, at this time we do not expect to be able to ship Scythe pieces by then, however, we do expect them to be finished shortly after the holidays, still several months ahead of schedule! We actually fully expect, at this point, that the entire project will likely ship earlier than the original estimate. So please, it is crucial for us that your addresses are kept current at all times.

Hello everyone! It's been over a month since our last update, and we wanted to share some good news with you. 
Production Far Ahead of Schedule
When we set the estimated delivery date for this project, we wanted to allow plenty of time for production, quality control, and fulfillment. The good news is, at this time at least, it looks like everything will deliver quite early! We already have a number of the pieces done, with another batch set to arrive every 7-10 days until the end of the year. The meeples are being air shipped to us, so we can get them into your hands faster as well.

Surveys Coming Out Shortly
Just a quick update to let you know that Backerkit surveys are about to be sent out so please be on the lookout for them so you don't miss the email. Please do take a few minutes to fill them out as soon as you are able so we can have accurate counts of how many pieces need to be produced for each character.
